2573 /* Send an UPDATE message to the specified link carrying the specified 'node'
2574  * slots configuration. The node name, slots bitmap, and configEpoch info
2575  * are included. */
2576 void clusterSendUpdate(clusterLink *link, clusterNode *node) {
2577  unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2578  clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2579 
2580  if (link == NULL) return;
2581  clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE);
2582  memcpy(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.nodename,node->name,CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
2583  hdr->data.update.nodecfg.configEpoch = htonu64(node->configEpoch);
2584  memcpy(hdr->data.update.nodecfg.slots,node->slots,sizeof(node->slots));
2585  clusterSendMessage(link,buf,ntohl(hdr->totlen));
2586 }

2588 /* Send a MODULE message.
2589  *
2590  * If link is NULL, then the message is broadcasted to the whole cluster. */
2591 void clusterSendModule(clusterLink *link, uint64_t module_id, uint8_t type,
2592  unsigned char *payload, uint32_t len) {
2593  unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)], *heapbuf;
2594  clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2595  uint32_t totlen;
2596 
2597  clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MODULE);
2598  totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2599  totlen += sizeof(clusterMsgModule) - 3 + len;
2600 
2601  hdr->data.module.msg.module_id = module_id; /* Already endian adjusted. */
2602  hdr->data.module.msg.type = type;
2603  hdr->data.module.msg.len = htonl(len);
2604  hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2605 
2606  /* Try to use the local buffer if possible */
2607  if (totlen < sizeof(buf)) {
2608  heapbuf = buf;
2609  } else {
2610  heapbuf = zmalloc(totlen);
2611  memcpy(heapbuf,hdr,sizeof(*hdr));
2612  hdr = (clusterMsg*) heapbuf;
2613  }
2614  memcpy(hdr->data.module.msg.bulk_data,payload,len);
2615 
2616  if (link)
2617  clusterSendMessage(link,heapbuf,totlen);
2618  else
2619  clusterBroadcastMessage(heapbuf,totlen);
2620 
2621  if (heapbuf != buf) zfree(heapbuf);
2622 }

2624 /* This function gets a cluster node ID string as target, the same way the nodes
2625  * addresses are represented in the modules side, resolves the node, and sends
2626  * the message. If the target is NULL the message is broadcasted.
2627  *
2628  * The function returns C_OK if the target is valid, otherwise C_ERR is
2629  * returned. */
2630 int clusterSendModuleMessageToTarget(const char *target, uint64_t module_id, uint8_t type, unsigned char *payload, uint32_t len) {
2631  clusterNode *node = NULL;
2632 
2633  if (target != NULL) {
2634  node = clusterLookupNode(target);
2635  if (node == NULL || node->link == NULL) return C_ERR;
2636  }
2637 
2638  clusterSendModule(target ? node->link : NULL,
2639  module_id, type, payload, len);
2640  return C_OK;
2641 }

2658 /* This function sends a FAILOVE_AUTH_REQUEST message to every node in order to
2659  * see if there is the quorum for this slave instance to failover its failing
2660  * master.
2661  *
2662  * Note that we send the failover request to everybody, master and slave nodes,
2663  * but only the masters are supposed to reply to our query. */
2664 void clusterRequestFailoverAuth(void) {
2665  unsigned char buf[sizeof(clusterMsg)];
2666  clusterMsg *hdr = (clusterMsg*) buf;
2667  uint32_t totlen;
2668 
2669  clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_REQUEST);
2670  /* If this is a manual failover, set the CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK bit
2671  * in the header to communicate the nodes receiving the message that
2672  * they should authorized the failover even if the master is working. */
2673  if (server.cluster->mf_end) hdr->mflags[0] |= CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK;
2674  totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2675  hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2676  clusterBroadcastMessage(buf,totlen);
2677 }

2684 
2685  if (!node->link) return;
2686  clusterBuildMessageHdr(hdr,CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK);
2687  totlen = sizeof(clusterMsg)-sizeof(union clusterMsgData);
2688  hdr->totlen = htonl(totlen);
2689  clusterSendMessage(node->link,buf,totlen);
2690 }

2705 /* Vote for the node asking for our vote if there are the conditions. */
2706 void clusterSendFailoverAuthIfNeeded(clusterNode *node, clusterMsg *request) {
2707  clusterNode *master = node->slaveof;
2708  uint64_t requestCurrentEpoch = ntohu64(request->currentEpoch);
2709  uint64_t requestConfigEpoch = ntohu64(request->configEpoch);
2710  unsigned char *claimed_slots = request->myslots;
2711  int force_ack = request->mflags[0] & CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK;
2712  int j;
2713 
2714  /* IF we are not a master serving at least 1 slot, we don't have the
2715  * right to vote, as the cluster size in Redis Cluster is the number
2716  * of masters serving at least one slot, and quorum is the cluster
2717  * size + 1 */
2718  if (nodeIsSlave(myself) || myself->numslots == 0) return;
2719 
2720  /* Request epoch must be >= our currentEpoch.
2721  * Note that it is impossible for it to actually be greater since
2722  * our currentEpoch was updated as a side effect of receiving this
2723  * request, if the request epoch was greater. */
2724  if (requestCurrentEpoch < server.cluster->currentEpoch) {
2725  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2726  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: reqEpoch (%llu) < curEpoch(%llu)",
2727  node->name,
2728  (unsigned long long) requestCurrentEpoch,
2729  (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2730  return;
2731  }
2732 
2733  /* I already voted for this epoch? Return ASAP. */
2734  if (server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch == server.cluster->currentEpoch) {
2735  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2736  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: already voted for epoch %llu",
2737  node->name,
2738  (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2739  return;
2740  }
2741 
2742  /* Node must be a slave and its master down.
2743  * The master can be non failing if the request is flagged
2744  * with CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_FORCEACK (manual failover). */
2745  if (nodeIsMaster(node) || master == NULL ||
2746  (!nodeFailed(master) && !force_ack))
2747  {
2748  if (nodeIsMaster(node)) {
2749  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2750  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: it is a master node",
2751  node->name);
2752  } else if (master == NULL) {
2753  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2754  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: I don't know its master",
2755  node->name);
2756  } else if (!nodeFailed(master)) {
2757  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2758  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: its master is up",
2759  node->name);
2760  }
2761  return;
2762  }
2763 
2764  /* We did not voted for a slave about this master for two
2765  * times the node timeout. This is not strictly needed for correctness
2766  * of the algorithm but makes the base case more linear. */
2767  if (mstime() - node->slaveof->voted_time < server.cluster_node_timeout * 2)
2768  {
2769  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2770  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: "
2771  "can't vote about this master before %lld milliseconds",
2772  node->name,
2773  (long long) ((server.cluster_node_timeout*2)-
2774  (mstime() - node->slaveof->voted_time)));
2775  return;
2776  }
2777 
2778  /* The slave requesting the vote must have a configEpoch for the claimed
2779  * slots that is >= the one of the masters currently serving the same
2780  * slots in the current configuration. */
2781  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
2782  if (bitmapTestBit(claimed_slots, j) == 0) continue;
2783  if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL ||
2784  server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch <= requestConfigEpoch)
2785  {
2786  continue;
2787  }
2788  /* If we reached this point we found a slot that in our current slots
2789  * is served by a master with a greater configEpoch than the one claimed
2790  * by the slave requesting our vote. Refuse to vote for this slave. */
2791  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
2792  "Failover auth denied to %.40s: "
2793  "slot %d epoch (%llu) > reqEpoch (%llu)",
2794  node->name, j,
2795  (unsigned long long) server.cluster->slots[j]->configEpoch,
2796  (unsigned long long) requestConfigEpoch);
2797  return;
2798  }
2799 
2800  /* We can vote for this slave. */
2801  server.cluster->lastVoteEpoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
2802  node->slaveof->voted_time = mstime();
2803  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
2804  clusterSendFailoverAuth(node);
2805  serverLog(LL_WARNING, "Failover auth granted to %.40s for epoch %llu",
2806  node->name, (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
2807 }
2808 
2809 /* This function returns the "rank" of this instance, a slave, in the context
2810  * of its master-slaves ring. The rank of the slave is given by the number of
2811  * other slaves for the same master that have a better replication offset
2812  * compared to the local one (better means, greater, so they claim more data).
2813  *
2814  * A slave with rank 0 is the one with the greatest (most up to date)
2815  * replication offset, and so forth. Note that because how the rank is computed
2816  * multiple slaves may have the same rank, in case they have the same offset.
2817  *
2818  * The slave rank is used to add a delay to start an election in order to
2819  * get voted and replace a failing master. Slaves with better replication
2820  * offsets are more likely to win. */
2821 int clusterGetSlaveRank(void) {
2822  long long myoffset;
2823  int j, rank = 0;
2824  clusterNode *master;
2825 
2826  serverAssert(nodeIsSlave(myself));
2827  master = myself->slaveof;
2828  if (master == NULL) return 0; /* Never called by slaves without master. */
2829 
2830  myoffset = replicationGetSlaveOffset();
2831  for (j = 0; j < master->numslaves; j++)
2832  if (master->slaves[j] != myself &&
2833  !nodeCantFailover(master->slaves[j]) &&
2834  master->slaves[j]->repl_offset > myoffset) rank++;
2835  return rank;
2836 }
2837 
2838 /* This function is called by clusterHandleSlaveFailover() in order to
2839  * let the slave log why it is not able to failover. Sometimes there are
2840  * not the conditions, but since the failover function is called again and
2841  * again, we can't log the same things continuously.
2842  *
2843  * This function works by logging only if a given set of conditions are
2844  * true:
2845  *
2846  * 1) The reason for which the failover can't be initiated changed.
2847  * The reasons also include a NONE reason we reset the state to
2848  * when the slave finds that its master is fine (no FAIL flag).
2849  * 2) Also, the log is emitted again if the master is still down and
2850  * the reason for not failing over is still the same, but more than
2851  * CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_RELOG_PERIOD seconds elapsed.
2852  * 3) Finally, the function only logs if the slave is down for more than
2853  * five seconds + NODE_TIMEOUT. This way nothing is logged when a
2854  * failover starts in a reasonable time.
2855  *
2856  * The function is called with the reason why the slave can't failover
2857  * which is one of the integer macros CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_*.
2858  *
2859  * The function is guaranteed to be called only if 'myself' is a slave. */
2860 void clusterLogCantFailover(int reason) {
2861  char *msg;
2862  static time_t lastlog_time = 0;
2863  mstime_t nolog_fail_time = server.cluster_node_timeout + 5000;
2864 
2865  /* Don't log if we have the same reason for some time. */
2866  if (reason == server.cluster->cant_failover_reason &&
2867  time(NULL)-lastlog_time < CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_RELOG_PERIOD)
2868  return;
2869 
2870  server.cluster->cant_failover_reason = reason;
2871 
2872  /* We also don't emit any log if the master failed no long ago, the
2873  * goal of this function is to log slaves in a stalled condition for
2874  * a long time. */
2875  if (myself->slaveof &&
2876  nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) &&
2877  (mstime() - myself->slaveof->fail_time) < nolog_fail_time) return;
2878 
2879  switch(reason) {
2880  case CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_DATA_AGE:
2881  msg = "Disconnected from master for longer than allowed. "
2882  "Please check the 'cluster-replica-validity-factor' configuration "
2883  "option.";
2884  break;
2885  case CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_DELAY:
2886  msg = "Waiting the delay before I can start a new failover.";
2887  break;
2888  case CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_EXPIRED:
2889  msg = "Failover attempt expired.";
2890  break;
2891  case CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_VOTES:
2892  msg = "Waiting for votes, but majority still not reached.";
2893  break;
2894  default:
2895  msg = "Unknown reason code.";
2896  break;
2897  }
2898  lastlog_time = time(NULL);
2899  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Currently unable to failover: %s", msg);
2900 }
2901 
2902 /* This function implements the final part of automatic and manual failovers,
2903  * where the slave grabs its master's hash slots, and propagates the new
2904  * configuration.
2905  *
2906  * Note that it's up to the caller to be sure that the node got a new
2907  * configuration epoch already. */
2908 void clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster(void) {
2909  int j;
2910  clusterNode *oldmaster = myself->slaveof;
2911 
2912  if (nodeIsMaster(myself) || oldmaster == NULL) return;
2913 
2914  /* 1) Turn this node into a master. */
2915  clusterSetNodeAsMaster(myself);
2916  replicationUnsetMaster();
2917 
2918  /* 2) Claim all the slots assigned to our master. */
2919  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
2920  if (clusterNodeGetSlotBit(oldmaster,j)) {
2921  clusterDelSlot(j);
2922  clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
2923  }
2924  }
2925 
2926  /* 3) Update state and save config. */
2927  clusterUpdateState();
2928  clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
2929 
2930  /* 4) Pong all the other nodes so that they can update the state
2931  * accordingly and detect that we switched to master role. */
2932  clusterBroadcastPong(CLUSTER_BROADCAST_ALL);
2933 
2934  /* 5) If there was a manual failover in progress, clear the state. */
2935  resetManualFailover();
2936 }
2937 
2938 /* This function is called if we are a slave node and our master serving
2939  * a non-zero amount of hash slots is in FAIL state.
2940  *
2941  * The gaol of this function is:
2942  * 1) To check if we are able to perform a failover, is our data updated?
2943  * 2) Try to get elected by masters.
2944  * 3) Perform the failover informing all the other nodes.
2945  */
2946 void clusterHandleSlaveFailover(void) {
2947  mstime_t data_age;
2948  mstime_t auth_age = mstime() - server.cluster->failover_auth_time;
2949  int needed_quorum = (server.cluster->size / 2) + 1;
2950  int manual_failover = server.cluster->mf_end != 0 &&
2951  server.cluster->mf_can_start;
2952  mstime_t auth_timeout, auth_retry_time;
2953 
2954  server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_HANDLE_FAILOVER;
2955 
2956  /* Compute the failover timeout (the max time we have to send votes
2957  * and wait for replies), and the failover retry time (the time to wait
2958  * before trying to get voted again).
2959  *
2960  * Timeout is MAX(NODE_TIMEOUT*2,2000) milliseconds.
2961  * Retry is two times the Timeout.
2962  */
2963  auth_timeout = server.cluster_node_timeout*2;
2964  if (auth_timeout < 2000) auth_timeout = 2000;
2965  auth_retry_time = auth_timeout*2;
2966 
2967  /* Pre conditions to run the function, that must be met both in case
2968  * of an automatic or manual failover:
2969  * 1) We are a slave.
2970  * 2) Our master is flagged as FAIL, or this is a manual failover.
2971  * 3) We don't have the no failover configuration set, and this is
2972  * not a manual failover.
2973  * 4) It is serving slots. */
2974  if (nodeIsMaster(myself) ||
2975  myself->slaveof == NULL ||
2976  (!nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) && !manual_failover) ||
2977  (server.cluster_slave_no_failover && !manual_failover) ||
2978  myself->slaveof->numslots == 0)
2979  {
2980  /* There are no reasons to failover, so we set the reason why we
2981  * are returning without failing over to NONE. */
2982  server.cluster->cant_failover_reason = CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_NONE;
2983  return;
2984  }
2985 
2986  /* Set data_age to the number of seconds we are disconnected from
2987  * the master. */
2988  if (server.repl_state == REPL_STATE_CONNECTED) {
2989  data_age = (mstime_t)(server.unixtime - server.master->lastinteraction)
2990  * 1000;
2991  } else {
2992  data_age = (mstime_t)(server.unixtime - server.repl_down_since) * 1000;
2993  }
2994 
2995  /* Remove the node timeout from the data age as it is fine that we are
2996  * disconnected from our master at least for the time it was down to be
2997  * flagged as FAIL, that's the baseline. */
2998  if (data_age > server.cluster_node_timeout)
2999  data_age -= server.cluster_node_timeout;
3000 
3001  /* Check if our data is recent enough according to the slave validity
3002  * factor configured by the user.
3003  *
3004  * Check bypassed for manual failovers. */
3005  if (server.cluster_slave_validity_factor &&
3006  data_age >
3007  (((mstime_t)server.repl_ping_slave_period * 1000) +
3008  (server.cluster_node_timeout * server.cluster_slave_validity_factor)))
3009  {
3010  if (!manual_failover) {
3011  clusterLogCantFailover(CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_DATA_AGE);
3012  return;
3013  }
3014  }
3015 
3016  /* If the previous failover attempt timedout and the retry time has
3017  * elapsed, we can setup a new one. */
3018  if (auth_age > auth_retry_time) {
3019  server.cluster->failover_auth_time = mstime() +
3020  500 + /* Fixed delay of 500 milliseconds, let FAIL msg propagate. */
3021  random() % 500; /* Random delay between 0 and 500 milliseconds. */
3022  server.cluster->failover_auth_count = 0;
3023  server.cluster->failover_auth_sent = 0;
3024  server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = clusterGetSlaveRank();
3025  /* We add another delay that is proportional to the slave rank.
3026  * Specifically 1 second * rank. This way slaves that have a probably
3027  * less updated replication offset, are penalized. */
3028  server.cluster->failover_auth_time +=
3029  server.cluster->failover_auth_rank * 1000;
3030  /* However if this is a manual failover, no delay is needed. */
3031  if (server.cluster->mf_end) {
3032  server.cluster->failover_auth_time = mstime();
3033  server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = 0;
3034  }
3035  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3036  "Start of election delayed for %lld milliseconds "
3037  "(rank #%d, offset %lld).",
3038  server.cluster->failover_auth_time - mstime(),
3039  server.cluster->failover_auth_rank,
3040  replicationGetSlaveOffset());
3041  /* Now that we have a scheduled election, broadcast our offset
3042  * to all the other slaves so that they'll updated their offsets
3043  * if our offset is better. */
3044  clusterBroadcastPong(CLUSTER_BROADCAST_LOCAL_SLAVES);
3045  return;
3046  }
3047 
3048  /* It is possible that we received more updated offsets from other
3049  * slaves for the same master since we computed our election delay.
3050  * Update the delay if our rank changed.
3051  *
3052  * Not performed if this is a manual failover. */
3053  if (server.cluster->failover_auth_sent == 0 &&
3054  server.cluster->mf_end == 0)
3055  {
3056  int newrank = clusterGetSlaveRank();
3057  if (newrank > server.cluster->failover_auth_rank) {
3058  long long added_delay =
3059  (newrank - server.cluster->failover_auth_rank) * 1000;
3060  server.cluster->failover_auth_time += added_delay;
3061  server.cluster->failover_auth_rank = newrank;
3062  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3063  "Replica rank updated to #%d, added %lld milliseconds of delay.",
3064  newrank, added_delay);
3065  }
3066  }
3067 
3068  /* Return ASAP if we can't still start the election. */
3069  if (mstime() < server.cluster->failover_auth_time) {
3070  clusterLogCantFailover(CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_DELAY);
3071  return;
3072  }
3073 
3074  /* Return ASAP if the election is too old to be valid. */
3075  if (auth_age > auth_timeout) {
3076  clusterLogCantFailover(CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_EXPIRED);
3077  return;
3078  }
3079 
3080  /* Ask for votes if needed. */
3081  if (server.cluster->failover_auth_sent == 0) {
3082  server.cluster->currentEpoch++;
3083  server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch = server.cluster->currentEpoch;
3084  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Starting a failover election for epoch %llu.",
3085  (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch);
3086  clusterRequestFailoverAuth();
3087  server.cluster->failover_auth_sent = 1;
3088  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|
3089  CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
3090  CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG);
3091  return; /* Wait for replies. */
3092  }
3093 
3094  /* Check if we reached the quorum. */
3095  if (server.cluster->failover_auth_count >= needed_quorum) {
3096  /* We have the quorum, we can finally failover the master. */
3097 
3098  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3099  "Failover election won: I'm the new master.");
3100 
3101  /* Update my configEpoch to the epoch of the election. */
3102  if (myself->configEpoch < server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch) {
3103  myself->configEpoch = server.cluster->failover_auth_epoch;
3104  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3105  "configEpoch set to %llu after successful failover",
3106  (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
3107  }
3108 
3109  /* Take responsibility for the cluster slots. */
3110  clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster();
3111  } else {
3112  clusterLogCantFailover(CLUSTER_CANT_FAILOVER_WAITING_VOTES);
3113  }
3114 }
3115 
3116 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3117  * CLUSTER slave migration
3118  *
3119  * Slave migration is the process that allows a slave of a master that is
3120  * already covered by at least another slave, to "migrate" to a master that
3121  * is orpaned, that is, left with no working slaves.
3122  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3123 
3124 /* This function is responsible to decide if this replica should be migrated
3125  * to a different (orphaned) master. It is called by the clusterCron() function
3126  * only if:
3127  *
3128  * 1) We are a slave node.
3129  * 2) It was detected that there is at least one orphaned master in
3130  * the cluster.
3131  * 3) We are a slave of one of the masters with the greatest number of
3132  * slaves.
3133  *
3134  * This checks are performed by the caller since it requires to iterate
3135  * the nodes anyway, so we spend time into clusterHandleSlaveMigration()
3136  * if definitely needed.
3137  *
3138  * The fuction is called with a pre-computed max_slaves, that is the max
3139  * number of working (not in FAIL state) slaves for a single master.
3140  *
3141  * Additional conditions for migration are examined inside the function.
3142  */
3143 void clusterHandleSlaveMigration(int max_slaves) {
3144  int j, okslaves = 0;
3145  clusterNode *mymaster = myself->slaveof, *target = NULL, *candidate = NULL;
3146  dictIterator *di;
3147  dictEntry *de;
3148 
3149  /* Step 1: Don't migrate if the cluster state is not ok. */
3150  if (server.cluster->state != CLUSTER_OK) return;
3151 
3152  /* Step 2: Don't migrate if my master will not be left with at least
3153  * 'migration-barrier' slaves after my migration. */
3154  if (mymaster == NULL) return;
3155  for (j = 0; j < mymaster->numslaves; j++)
3156  if (!nodeFailed(mymaster->slaves[j]) &&
3157  !nodeTimedOut(mymaster->slaves[j])) okslaves++;
3158  if (okslaves <= server.cluster_migration_barrier) return;
3159 
3160  /* Step 3: Identify a candidate for migration, and check if among the
3161  * masters with the greatest number of ok slaves, I'm the one with the
3162  * smallest node ID (the "candidate slave").
3163  *
3164  * Note: this means that eventually a replica migration will occur
3165  * since slaves that are reachable again always have their FAIL flag
3166  * cleared, so eventually there must be a candidate. At the same time
3167  * this does not mean that there are no race conditions possible (two
3168  * slaves migrating at the same time), but this is unlikely to
3169  * happen, and harmless when happens. */
3170  candidate = myself;
3171  di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3172  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3173  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3174  int okslaves = 0, is_orphaned = 1;
3175 
3176  /* We want to migrate only if this master is working, orphaned, and
3177  * used to have slaves or if failed over a master that had slaves
3178  * (MIGRATE_TO flag). This way we only migrate to instances that were
3179  * supposed to have replicas. */
3180  if (nodeIsSlave(node) || nodeFailed(node)) is_orphaned = 0;
3181  if (!(node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_MIGRATE_TO)) is_orphaned = 0;
3182 
3183  /* Check number of working slaves. */
3184  if (nodeIsMaster(node)) okslaves = clusterCountNonFailingSlaves(node);
3185  if (okslaves > 0) is_orphaned = 0;
3186 
3187  if (is_orphaned) {
3188  if (!target && node->numslots > 0) target = node;
3189 
3190  /* Track the starting time of the orphaned condition for this
3191  * master. */
3192  if (!node->orphaned_time) node->orphaned_time = mstime();
3193  } else {
3194  node->orphaned_time = 0;
3195  }
3196 
3197  /* Check if I'm the slave candidate for the migration: attached
3198  * to a master with the maximum number of slaves and with the smallest
3199  * node ID. */
3200  if (okslaves == max_slaves) {
3201  for (j = 0; j < node->numslaves; j++) {
3202  if (memcmp(node->slaves[j]->name,
3203  candidate->name,
3204  CLUSTER_NAMELEN) < 0)
3205  {
3206  candidate = node->slaves[j];
3207  }
3208  }
3209  }
3210  }
3211  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3212 
3213  /* Step 4: perform the migration if there is a target, and if I'm the
3214  * candidate, but only if the master is continuously orphaned for a
3215  * couple of seconds, so that during failovers, we give some time to
3216  * the natural slaves of this instance to advertise their switch from
3217  * the old master to the new one. */
3218  if (target && candidate == myself &&
3219  (mstime()-target->orphaned_time) > CLUSTER_SLAVE_MIGRATION_DELAY &&
3220  !(server.cluster_module_flags & CLUSTER_MODULE_FLAG_NO_FAILOVER))
3221  {
3222  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Migrating to orphaned master %.40s",
3223  target->name);
3224  clusterSetMaster(target);
3225  }
3226 }
3227 
3228 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3229  * CLUSTER manual failover
3230  *
3231  * This are the important steps performed by slaves during a manual failover:
3232  * 1) User send CLUSTER FAILOVER command. The failover state is initialized
3233  * setting mf_end to the millisecond unix time at which we'll abort the
3234  * attempt.
3235  * 2) Slave sends a MFSTART message to the master requesting to pause clients
3236  * for two times the manual failover timeout CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT.
3237  * When master is paused for manual failover, it also starts to flag
3238  * packets with CLUSTERMSG_FLAG0_PAUSED.
3239  * 3) Slave waits for master to send its replication offset flagged as PAUSED.
3240  * 4) If slave received the offset from the master, and its offset matches,
3241  * mf_can_start is set to 1, and clusterHandleSlaveFailover() will perform
3242  * the failover as usually, with the difference that the vote request
3243  * will be modified to force masters to vote for a slave that has a
3244  * working master.
3245  *
3246  * From the point of view of the master things are simpler: when a
3247  * PAUSE_CLIENTS packet is received the master sets mf_end as well and
3248  * the sender in mf_slave. During the time limit for the manual failover
3249  * the master will just send PINGs more often to this slave, flagged with
3250  * the PAUSED flag, so that the slave will set mf_master_offset when receiving
3251  * a packet from the master with this flag set.
3252  *
3253  * The gaol of the manual failover is to perform a fast failover without
3254  * data loss due to the asynchronous master-slave replication.
3255  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3256 
3257 /* Reset the manual failover state. This works for both masters and slavesa
3258  * as all the state about manual failover is cleared.
3259  *
3260  * The function can be used both to initialize the manual failover state at
3261  * startup or to abort a manual failover in progress. */
3262 void resetManualFailover(void) {
3263  if (server.cluster->mf_end && clientsArePaused()) {
3264  server.clients_pause_end_time = 0;
3265  clientsArePaused(); /* Just use the side effect of the function. */
3266  }
3267  server.cluster->mf_end = 0; /* No manual failover in progress. */
3268  server.cluster->mf_can_start = 0;
3269  server.cluster->mf_slave = NULL;
3270  server.cluster->mf_master_offset = 0;
3271 }
3272 
3273 /* If a manual failover timed out, abort it. */
3274 void manualFailoverCheckTimeout(void) {
3275  if (server.cluster->mf_end && server.cluster->mf_end < mstime()) {
3276  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Manual failover timed out.");
3277  resetManualFailover();
3278  }
3279 }
3280 
3281 /* This function is called from the cluster cron function in order to go
3282  * forward with a manual failover state machine. */
3283 void clusterHandleManualFailover(void) {
3284  /* Return ASAP if no manual failover is in progress. */
3285  if (server.cluster->mf_end == 0) return;
3286 
3287  /* If mf_can_start is non-zero, the failover was already triggered so the
3288  * next steps are performed by clusterHandleSlaveFailover(). */
3289  if (server.cluster->mf_can_start) return;
3290 
3291  if (server.cluster->mf_master_offset == 0) return; /* Wait for offset... */
3292 
3293  if (server.cluster->mf_master_offset == replicationGetSlaveOffset()) {
3294  /* Our replication offset matches the master replication offset
3295  * announced after clients were paused. We can start the failover. */
3296  server.cluster->mf_can_start = 1;
3297  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
3298  "All master replication stream processed, "
3299  "manual failover can start.");
3300  }
3301 }
3302 
3303 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3304  * CLUSTER cron job
3305  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3306 
3307 /* This is executed 10 times every second */
3308 void clusterCron(void) {
3309  dictIterator *di;
3310  dictEntry *de;
3311  int update_state = 0;
3312  int orphaned_masters; /* How many masters there are without ok slaves. */
3313  int max_slaves; /* Max number of ok slaves for a single master. */
3314  int this_slaves; /* Number of ok slaves for our master (if we are slave). */
3315  mstime_t min_pong = 0, now = mstime();
3316  clusterNode *min_pong_node = NULL;
3317  static unsigned long long iteration = 0;
3318  mstime_t handshake_timeout;
3319 
3320  iteration++; /* Number of times this function was called so far. */
3321 
3322  /* We want to take myself->ip in sync with the cluster-announce-ip option.
3323  * The option can be set at runtime via CONFIG SET, so we periodically check
3324  * if the option changed to reflect this into myself->ip. */
3325  {
3326  static char *prev_ip = NULL;
3327  char *curr_ip = server.cluster_announce_ip;
3328  int changed = 0;
3329 
3330  if (prev_ip == NULL && curr_ip != NULL) changed = 1;
3331  else if (prev_ip != NULL && curr_ip == NULL) changed = 1;
3332  else if (prev_ip && curr_ip && strcmp(prev_ip,curr_ip)) changed = 1;
3333 
3334  if (changed) {
3335  if (prev_ip) zfree(prev_ip);
3336  prev_ip = curr_ip;
3337 
3338  if (curr_ip) {
3339  /* We always take a copy of the previous IP address, by
3340  * duplicating the string. This way later we can check if
3341  * the address really changed. */
3342  prev_ip = zstrdup(prev_ip);
3343  strncpy(myself->ip,server.cluster_announce_ip,NET_IP_STR_LEN);
3344  myself->ip[NET_IP_STR_LEN-1] = '\0';
3345  } else {
3346  myself->ip[0] = '\0'; /* Force autodetection. */
3347  }
3348  }
3349  }
3350 
3351  /* The handshake timeout is the time after which a handshake node that was
3352  * not turned into a normal node is removed from the nodes. Usually it is
3353  * just the NODE_TIMEOUT value, but when NODE_TIMEOUT is too small we use
3354  * the value of 1 second. */
3355  handshake_timeout = server.cluster_node_timeout;
3356  if (handshake_timeout < 1000) handshake_timeout = 1000;
3357 
3358  /* Update myself flags. */
3359  clusterUpdateMyselfFlags();
3360 
3361  /* Check if we have disconnected nodes and re-establish the connection.
3362  * Also update a few stats while we are here, that can be used to make
3363  * better decisions in other part of the code. */
3364  di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3365  server.cluster->stats_pfail_nodes = 0;
3366  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3367  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3368 
3369  /* Not interested in reconnecting the link with myself or nodes
3370  * for which we have no address. */
3371  if (node->flags & (CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF|CLUSTER_NODE_NOADDR)) continue;
3372 
3373  if (node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_PFAIL)
3374  server.cluster->stats_pfail_nodes++;
3375 
3376  /* A Node in HANDSHAKE state has a limited lifespan equal to the
3377  * configured node timeout. */
3378  if (nodeInHandshake(node) && now - node->ctime > handshake_timeout) {
3379  clusterDelNode(node);
3380  continue;
3381  }
3382 
3383  if (node->link == NULL) {
3384  int fd;
3385  mstime_t old_ping_sent;
3386  clusterLink *link;
3387 
3388  fd = anetTcpNonBlockBindConnect(server.neterr, node->ip,
3389  node->cport, NET_FIRST_BIND_ADDR);
3390  if (fd == -1) {
3391  /* We got a synchronous error from connect before
3392  * clusterSendPing() had a chance to be called.
3393  * If node->ping_sent is zero, failure detection can't work,
3394  * so we claim we actually sent a ping now (that will
3395  * be really sent as soon as the link is obtained). */
3396  if (node->ping_sent == 0) node->ping_sent = mstime();
3397  serverLog(LL_DEBUG, "Unable to connect to "
3398  "Cluster Node [%s]:%d -> %s", node->ip,
3399  node->cport, server.neterr);
3400  continue;
3401  }
3402  link = createClusterLink(node);
3403  link->fd = fd;
3404  node->link = link;
3405  aeCreateFileEvent(server.el,link->fd,AE_READABLE,
3406  clusterReadHandler,link);
3407  /* Queue a PING in the new connection ASAP: this is crucial
3408  * to avoid false positives in failure detection.
3409  *
3410  * If the node is flagged as MEET, we send a MEET message instead
3411  * of a PING one, to force the receiver to add us in its node
3412  * table. */
3413  old_ping_sent = node->ping_sent;
3414  clusterSendPing(link, node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_MEET ?
3415  CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET : CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3416  if (old_ping_sent) {
3417  /* If there was an active ping before the link was
3418  * disconnected, we want to restore the ping time, otherwise
3419  * replaced by the clusterSendPing() call. */
3420  node->ping_sent = old_ping_sent;
3421  }
3422  /* We can clear the flag after the first packet is sent.
3423  * If we'll never receive a PONG, we'll never send new packets
3424  * to this node. Instead after the PONG is received and we
3425  * are no longer in meet/handshake status, we want to send
3426  * normal PING packets. */
3427  node->flags &= ~CLUSTER_NODE_MEET;
3428 
3429  serverLog(LL_DEBUG,"Connecting with Node %.40s at %s:%d",
3430  node->name, node->ip, node->cport);
3431  }
3432  }
3433  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3434 
3435  /* Ping some random node 1 time every 10 iterations, so that we usually ping
3436  * one random node every second. */
3437  if (!(iteration % 10)) {
3438  int j;
3439 
3440  /* Check a few random nodes and ping the one with the oldest
3441  * pong_received time. */
3442  for (j = 0; j < 5; j++) {
3443  de = dictGetRandomKey(server.cluster->nodes);
3444  clusterNode *this = dictGetVal(de);
3445 
3446  /* Don't ping nodes disconnected or with a ping currently active. */
3447  if (this->link == NULL || this->ping_sent != 0) continue;
3448  if (this->flags & (CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF|CLUSTER_NODE_HANDSHAKE))
3449  continue;
3450  if (min_pong_node == NULL || min_pong > this->pong_received) {
3451  min_pong_node = this;
3452  min_pong = this->pong_received;
3453  }
3454  }
3455  if (min_pong_node) {
3456  serverLog(LL_DEBUG,"Pinging node %.40s", min_pong_node->name);
3457  clusterSendPing(min_pong_node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3458  }
3459  }
3460 
3461  /* Iterate nodes to check if we need to flag something as failing.
3462  * This loop is also responsible to:
3463  * 1) Check if there are orphaned masters (masters without non failing
3464  * slaves).
3465  * 2) Count the max number of non failing slaves for a single master.
3466  * 3) Count the number of slaves for our master, if we are a slave. */
3467  orphaned_masters = 0;
3468  max_slaves = 0;
3469  this_slaves = 0;
3470  di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3471  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3472  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3473  now = mstime(); /* Use an updated time at every iteration. */
3474  mstime_t delay;
3475 
3476  if (node->flags &
3477  (CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF|CLUSTER_NODE_NOADDR|CLUSTER_NODE_HANDSHAKE))
3478  continue;
3479 
3480  /* Orphaned master check, useful only if the current instance
3481  * is a slave that may migrate to another master. */
3482  if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && nodeIsMaster(node) && !nodeFailed(node)) {
3483  int okslaves = clusterCountNonFailingSlaves(node);
3484 
3485  /* A master is orphaned if it is serving a non-zero number of
3486  * slots, have no working slaves, but used to have at least one
3487  * slave, or failed over a master that used to have slaves. */
3488  if (okslaves == 0 && node->numslots > 0 &&
3489  node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_MIGRATE_TO)
3490  {
3491  orphaned_masters++;
3492  }
3493  if (okslaves > max_slaves) max_slaves = okslaves;
3494  if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof == node)
3495  this_slaves = okslaves;
3496  }
3497 
3498  /* If we are waiting for the PONG more than half the cluster
3499  * timeout, reconnect the link: maybe there is a connection
3500  * issue even if the node is alive. */
3501  if (node->link && /* is connected */
3502  now - node->link->ctime >
3503  server.cluster_node_timeout && /* was not already reconnected */
3504  node->ping_sent && /* we already sent a ping */
3505  node->pong_received < node->ping_sent && /* still waiting pong */
3506  /* and we are waiting for the pong more than timeout/2 */
3507  now - node->ping_sent > server.cluster_node_timeout/2)
3508  {
3509  /* Disconnect the link, it will be reconnected automatically. */
3510  freeClusterLink(node->link);
3511  }
3512 
3513  /* If we have currently no active ping in this instance, and the
3514  * received PONG is older than half the cluster timeout, send
3515  * a new ping now, to ensure all the nodes are pinged without
3516  * a too big delay. */
3517  if (node->link &&
3518  node->ping_sent == 0 &&
3519  (now - node->pong_received) > server.cluster_node_timeout/2)
3520  {
3521  clusterSendPing(node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3522  continue;
3523  }
3524 
3525  /* If we are a master and one of the slaves requested a manual
3526  * failover, ping it continuously. */
3527  if (server.cluster->mf_end &&
3528  nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3529  server.cluster->mf_slave == node &&
3530  node->link)
3531  {
3532  clusterSendPing(node->link, CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING);
3533  continue;
3534  }
3535 
3536  /* Check only if we have an active ping for this instance. */
3537  if (node->ping_sent == 0) continue;
3538 
3539  /* Compute the delay of the PONG. Note that if we already received
3540  * the PONG, then node->ping_sent is zero, so can't reach this
3541  * code at all. */
3542  delay = now - node->ping_sent;
3543 
3544  if (delay > server.cluster_node_timeout) {
3545  /* Timeout reached. Set the node as possibly failing if it is
3546  * not already in this state. */
3547  if (!(node->flags & (CLUSTER_NODE_PFAIL|CLUSTER_NODE_FAIL))) {
3548  serverLog(LL_DEBUG,"*** NODE %.40s possibly failing",
3549  node->name);
3550  node->flags |= CLUSTER_NODE_PFAIL;
3551  update_state = 1;
3552  }
3553  }
3554  }
3555  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3556 
3557  /* If we are a slave node but the replication is still turned off,
3558  * enable it if we know the address of our master and it appears to
3559  * be up. */
3560  if (nodeIsSlave(myself) &&
3561  server.masterhost == NULL &&
3562  myself->slaveof &&
3563  nodeHasAddr(myself->slaveof))
3564  {
3565  replicationSetMaster(myself->slaveof->ip, myself->slaveof->port);
3566  }
3567 
3568  /* Abourt a manual failover if the timeout is reached. */
3569  manualFailoverCheckTimeout();
3570 
3571  if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) {
3572  clusterHandleManualFailover();
3573  if (!(server.cluster_module_flags & CLUSTER_MODULE_FLAG_NO_FAILOVER))
3574  clusterHandleSlaveFailover();
3575  /* If there are orphaned slaves, and we are a slave among the masters
3576  * with the max number of non-failing slaves, consider migrating to
3577  * the orphaned masters. Note that it does not make sense to try
3578  * a migration if there is no master with at least *two* working
3579  * slaves. */
3580  if (orphaned_masters && max_slaves >= 2 && this_slaves == max_slaves)
3581  clusterHandleSlaveMigration(max_slaves);
3582  }
3583 
3584  if (update_state || server.cluster->state == CLUSTER_FAIL)
3585  clusterUpdateState();
3586 }
3587 
3588 /* This function is called before the event handler returns to sleep for
3589  * events. It is useful to perform operations that must be done ASAP in
3590  * reaction to events fired but that are not safe to perform inside event
3591  * handlers, or to perform potentially expansive tasks that we need to do
3592  * a single time before replying to clients. */
3593 void clusterBeforeSleep(void) {
3594  /* Handle failover, this is needed when it is likely that there is already
3595  * the quorum from masters in order to react fast. */
3596  if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_HANDLE_FAILOVER)
3597  clusterHandleSlaveFailover();
3598 
3599  /* Update the cluster state. */
3600  if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE)
3601  clusterUpdateState();
3602 
3603  /* Save the config, possibly using fsync. */
3604  if (server.cluster->todo_before_sleep & CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG) {
3605  int fsync = server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &
3606  CLUSTER_TODO_FSYNC_CONFIG;
3607  clusterSaveConfigOrDie(fsync);
3608  }
3609 
3610  /* Reset our flags (not strictly needed since every single function
3611  * called for flags set should be able to clear its flag). */
3612  server.cluster->todo_before_sleep = 0;
3613 }
3614 
3615 void clusterDoBeforeSleep(int flags) {
3616  server.cluster->todo_before_sleep |= flags;
3617 }
3618 
3619 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3620  * Slots management
3621  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3622 
3623 /* Test bit 'pos' in a generic bitmap. Return 1 if the bit is set,
3624  * otherwise 0. */
3625 int bitmapTestBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3626  off_t byte = pos/8;
3627  int bit = pos&7;
3628  return (bitmap[byte] & (1<<bit)) != 0;
3629 }
3630 
3631 /* Set the bit at position 'pos' in a bitmap. */
3632 void bitmapSetBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3633  off_t byte = pos/8;
3634  int bit = pos&7;
3635  bitmap[byte] |= 1<<bit;
3636 }
3637 
3638 /* Clear the bit at position 'pos' in a bitmap. */
3639 void bitmapClearBit(unsigned char *bitmap, int pos) {
3640  off_t byte = pos/8;
3641  int bit = pos&7;
3642  bitmap[byte] &= ~(1<<bit);
3643 }
3644 
3645 /* Return non-zero if there is at least one master with slaves in the cluster.
3646  * Otherwise zero is returned. Used by clusterNodeSetSlotBit() to set the
3647  * MIGRATE_TO flag the when a master gets the first slot. */
3648 int clusterMastersHaveSlaves(void) {
3649  dictIterator *di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3650  dictEntry *de;
3651  int slaves = 0;
3652  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3653  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3654 
3655  if (nodeIsSlave(node)) continue;
3656  slaves += node->numslaves;
3657  }
3658  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3659  return slaves != 0;
3660 }
3661 
3662 /* Set the slot bit and return the old value. */
3663 int clusterNodeSetSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3664  int old = bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3665  bitmapSetBit(n->slots,slot);
3666  if (!old) {
3667  n->numslots++;
3668  /* When a master gets its first slot, even if it has no slaves,
3669  * it gets flagged with MIGRATE_TO, that is, the master is a valid
3670  * target for replicas migration, if and only if at least one of
3671  * the other masters has slaves right now.
3672  *
3673  * Normally masters are valid targerts of replica migration if:
3674  * 1. The used to have slaves (but no longer have).
3675  * 2. They are slaves failing over a master that used to have slaves.
3676  *
3677  * However new masters with slots assigned are considered valid
3678  * migration tagets if the rest of the cluster is not a slave-less.
3679  *
3680  * See https://github.com/antirez/redis/issues/3043 for more info. */
3681  if (n->numslots == 1 && clusterMastersHaveSlaves())
3682  n->flags |= CLUSTER_NODE_MIGRATE_TO;
3683  }
3684  return old;
3685 }
3686 
3687 /* Clear the slot bit and return the old value. */
3688 int clusterNodeClearSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3689  int old = bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3690  bitmapClearBit(n->slots,slot);
3691  if (old) n->numslots--;
3692  return old;
3693 }
3694 
3695 /* Return the slot bit from the cluster node structure. */
3696 int clusterNodeGetSlotBit(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3697  return bitmapTestBit(n->slots,slot);
3698 }
3699 
3700 /* Add the specified slot to the list of slots that node 'n' will
3701  * serve. Return C_OK if the operation ended with success.
3702  * If the slot is already assigned to another instance this is considered
3703  * an error and C_ERR is returned. */
3704 int clusterAddSlot(clusterNode *n, int slot) {
3705  if (server.cluster->slots[slot]) return C_ERR;
3706  clusterNodeSetSlotBit(n,slot);
3707  server.cluster->slots[slot] = n;
3708  return C_OK;
3709 }
3710 
3711 /* Delete the specified slot marking it as unassigned.
3712  * Returns C_OK if the slot was assigned, otherwise if the slot was
3713  * already unassigned C_ERR is returned. */
3714 int clusterDelSlot(int slot) {
3715  clusterNode *n = server.cluster->slots[slot];
3716 
3717  if (!n) return C_ERR;
3718  serverAssert(clusterNodeClearSlotBit(n,slot) == 1);
3719  server.cluster->slots[slot] = NULL;
3720  return C_OK;
3721 }
3722 
3723 /* Delete all the slots associated with the specified node.
3724  * The number of deleted slots is returned. */
3725 int clusterDelNodeSlots(clusterNode *node) {
3726  int deleted = 0, j;
3727 
3728  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3729  if (clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) {
3730  clusterDelSlot(j);
3731  deleted++;
3732  }
3733  }
3734  return deleted;
3735 }
3736 
3737 /* Clear the migrating / importing state for all the slots.
3738  * This is useful at initialization and when turning a master into slave. */
3739 void clusterCloseAllSlots(void) {
3740  memset(server.cluster->migrating_slots_to,0,
3741  sizeof(server.cluster->migrating_slots_to));
3742  memset(server.cluster->importing_slots_from,0,
3743  sizeof(server.cluster->importing_slots_from));
3744 }
3745 
3746 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3747  * Cluster state evaluation function
3748  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3749 
3750 /* The following are defines that are only used in the evaluation function
3751  * and are based on heuristics. Actually the main point about the rejoin and
3752  * writable delay is that they should be a few orders of magnitude larger
3753  * than the network latency. */
3754 #define CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY 5000
3755 #define CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY 500
3756 #define CLUSTER_WRITABLE_DELAY 2000
3757 
3758 void clusterUpdateState(void) {
3759  int j, new_state;
3760  int reachable_masters = 0;
3761  static mstime_t among_minority_time;
3762  static mstime_t first_call_time = 0;
3763 
3764  server.cluster->todo_before_sleep &= ~CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE;
3765 
3766  /* If this is a master node, wait some time before turning the state
3767  * into OK, since it is not a good idea to rejoin the cluster as a writable
3768  * master, after a reboot, without giving the cluster a chance to
3769  * reconfigure this node. Note that the delay is calculated starting from
3770  * the first call to this function and not since the server start, in order
3771  * to don't count the DB loading time. */
3772  if (first_call_time == 0) first_call_time = mstime();
3773  if (nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3774  server.cluster->state == CLUSTER_FAIL &&
3775  mstime() - first_call_time < CLUSTER_WRITABLE_DELAY) return;
3776 
3777  /* Start assuming the state is OK. We'll turn it into FAIL if there
3778  * are the right conditions. */
3779  new_state = CLUSTER_OK;
3780 
3781  /* Check if all the slots are covered. */
3782  if (server.cluster_require_full_coverage) {
3783  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3784  if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL ||
3785  server.cluster->slots[j]->flags & (CLUSTER_NODE_FAIL))
3786  {
3787  new_state = CLUSTER_FAIL;
3788  break;
3789  }
3790  }
3791  }
3792 
3793  /* Compute the cluster size, that is the number of master nodes
3794  * serving at least a single slot.
3795  *
3796  * At the same time count the number of reachable masters having
3797  * at least one slot. */
3798  {
3799  dictIterator *di;
3800  dictEntry *de;
3801 
3802  server.cluster->size = 0;
3803  di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
3804  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
3805  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
3806 
3807  if (nodeIsMaster(node) && node->numslots) {
3808  server.cluster->size++;
3809  if ((node->flags & (CLUSTER_NODE_FAIL|CLUSTER_NODE_PFAIL)) == 0)
3810  reachable_masters++;
3811  }
3812  }
3813  dictReleaseIterator(di);
3814  }
3815 
3816  /* If we are in a minority partition, change the cluster state
3817  * to FAIL. */
3818  {
3819  int needed_quorum = (server.cluster->size / 2) + 1;
3820 
3821  if (reachable_masters < needed_quorum) {
3822  new_state = CLUSTER_FAIL;
3823  among_minority_time = mstime();
3824  }
3825  }
3826 
3827  /* Log a state change */
3828  if (new_state != server.cluster->state) {
3829  mstime_t rejoin_delay = server.cluster_node_timeout;
3830 
3831  /* If the instance is a master and was partitioned away with the
3832  * minority, don't let it accept queries for some time after the
3833  * partition heals, to make sure there is enough time to receive
3834  * a configuration update. */
3835  if (rejoin_delay > CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY)
3836  rejoin_delay = CLUSTER_MAX_REJOIN_DELAY;
3837  if (rejoin_delay < CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY)
3838  rejoin_delay = CLUSTER_MIN_REJOIN_DELAY;
3839 
3840  if (new_state == CLUSTER_OK &&
3841  nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
3842  mstime() - among_minority_time < rejoin_delay)
3843  {
3844  return;
3845  }
3846 
3847  /* Change the state and log the event. */
3848  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Cluster state changed: %s",
3849  new_state == CLUSTER_OK ? "ok" : "fail");
3850  server.cluster->state = new_state;
3851  }
3852 }
3853 
3854 /* This function is called after the node startup in order to verify that data
3855  * loaded from disk is in agreement with the cluster configuration:
3856  *
3857  * 1) If we find keys about hash slots we have no responsibility for, the
3858  * following happens:
3859  * A) If no other node is in charge according to the current cluster
3860  * configuration, we add these slots to our node.
3861  * B) If according to our config other nodes are already in charge for
3862  * this lots, we set the slots as IMPORTING from our point of view
3863  * in order to justify we have those slots, and in order to make
3864  * redis-trib aware of the issue, so that it can try to fix it.
3865  * 2) If we find data in a DB different than DB0 we return C_ERR to
3866  * signal the caller it should quit the server with an error message
3867  * or take other actions.
3868  *
3869  * The function always returns C_OK even if it will try to correct
3870  * the error described in "1". However if data is found in DB different
3871  * from DB0, C_ERR is returned.
3872  *
3873  * The function also uses the logging facility in order to warn the user
3874  * about desynchronizations between the data we have in memory and the
3875  * cluster configuration. */
3876 int verifyClusterConfigWithData(void) {
3877  int j;
3878  int update_config = 0;
3879 
3880  /* Return ASAP if a module disabled cluster redirections. In that case
3881  * every master can store keys about every possible hash slot. */
3882  if (server.cluster_module_flags & CLUSTER_MODULE_FLAG_NO_REDIRECTION)
3883  return C_OK;
3884 
3885  /* If this node is a slave, don't perform the check at all as we
3886  * completely depend on the replication stream. */
3887  if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) return C_OK;
3888 
3889  /* Make sure we only have keys in DB0. */
3890  for (j = 1; j < server.dbnum; j++) {
3891  if (dictSize(server.db[j].dict)) return C_ERR;
3892  }
3893 
3894  /* Check that all the slots we see populated memory have a corresponding
3895  * entry in the cluster table. Otherwise fix the table. */
3896  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
3897  if (!countKeysInSlot(j)) continue; /* No keys in this slot. */
3898  /* Check if we are assigned to this slot or if we are importing it.
3899  * In both cases check the next slot as the configuration makes
3900  * sense. */
3901  if (server.cluster->slots[j] == myself ||
3902  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] != NULL) continue;
3903 
3904  /* If we are here data and cluster config don't agree, and we have
3905  * slot 'j' populated even if we are not importing it, nor we are
3906  * assigned to this slot. Fix this condition. */
3907 
3908  update_config++;
3909  /* Case A: slot is unassigned. Take responsibility for it. */
3910  if (server.cluster->slots[j] == NULL) {
3911  serverLog(LL_WARNING, "I have keys for unassigned slot %d. "
3912  "Taking responsibility for it.",j);
3913  clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
3914  } else {
3915  serverLog(LL_WARNING, "I have keys for slot %d, but the slot is "
3916  "assigned to another node. "
3917  "Setting it to importing state.",j);
3918  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] = server.cluster->slots[j];
3919  }
3920  }
3921  if (update_config) clusterSaveConfigOrDie(1);
3922  return C_OK;
3923 }
3924 
3925 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3926  * SLAVE nodes handling
3927  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3928 
3929 /* Set the specified node 'n' as master for this node.
3930  * If this node is currently a master, it is turned into a slave. */
3931 void clusterSetMaster(clusterNode *n) {
3932  serverAssert(n != myself);
3933  serverAssert(myself->numslots == 0);
3934 
3935  if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) {
3936  myself->flags &= ~(CLUSTER_NODE_MASTER|CLUSTER_NODE_MIGRATE_TO);
3937  myself->flags |= CLUSTER_NODE_SLAVE;
3938  clusterCloseAllSlots();
3939  } else {
3940  if (myself->slaveof)
3941  clusterNodeRemoveSlave(myself->slaveof,myself);
3942  }
3943  myself->slaveof = n;
3944  clusterNodeAddSlave(n,myself);
3945  replicationSetMaster(n->ip, n->port);
3946  resetManualFailover();
3947 }
3948 
3949 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
3950  * Nodes to string representation functions.
3951  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
3952 
3953 struct redisNodeFlags {
3954  uint16_t flag;
3955  char *name;
3956 };
3957 
3958 static struct redisNodeFlags redisNodeFlagsTable[] = {
3959  {CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF, "myself,"},
3960  {CLUSTER_NODE_MASTER, "master,"},
3961  {CLUSTER_NODE_SLAVE, "slave,"},
3962  {CLUSTER_NODE_PFAIL, "fail?,"},
3963  {CLUSTER_NODE_FAIL, "fail,"},
3964  {CLUSTER_NODE_HANDSHAKE, "handshake,"},
3965  {CLUSTER_NODE_NOADDR, "noaddr,"},
3966  {CLUSTER_NODE_NOFAILOVER, "nofailover,"}
3967 };
3968 
3969 /* Concatenate the comma separated list of node flags to the given SDS
3970  * string 'ci'. */
3971 sds representClusterNodeFlags(sds ci, uint16_t flags) {
3972  size_t orig_len = sdslen(ci);
3973  int i, size = sizeof(redisNodeFlagsTable)/sizeof(struct redisNodeFlags);
3974  for (i = 0; i < size; i++) {
3975  struct redisNodeFlags *nodeflag = redisNodeFlagsTable + i;
3976  if (flags & nodeflag->flag) ci = sdscat(ci, nodeflag->name);
3977  }
3978  /* If no flag was added, add the "noflags" special flag. */
3979  if (sdslen(ci) == orig_len) ci = sdscat(ci,"noflags,");
3980  sdsIncrLen(ci,-1); /* Remove trailing comma. */
3981  return ci;
3982 }
3983 
3984 /* Generate a csv-alike representation of the specified cluster node.
3985  * See clusterGenNodesDescription() top comment for more information.
3986  *
3987  * The function returns the string representation as an SDS string. */
3988 sds clusterGenNodeDescription(clusterNode *node) {
3989  int j, start;
3990  sds ci;
3991 
3992  /* Node coordinates */
3993  ci = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"%.40s %s:%d@%d ",
3994  node->name,
3995  node->ip,
3996  node->port,
3997  node->cport);
3998 
3999  /* Flags */
4000  ci = representClusterNodeFlags(ci, node->flags);
4001 
4002  /* Slave of... or just "-" */
4003  if (node->slaveof)
4004  ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %.40s ",node->slaveof->name);
4005  else
4006  ci = sdscatlen(ci," - ",3);
4007 
4008  /* Latency from the POV of this node, config epoch, link status */
4009  ci = sdscatprintf(ci,"%lld %lld %llu %s",
4010  (long long) node->ping_sent,
4011  (long long) node->pong_received,
4012  (unsigned long long) node->configEpoch,
4013  (node->link || node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF) ?
4014  "connected" : "disconnected");
4015 
4016  /* Slots served by this instance */
4017  start = -1;
4018  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
4019  int bit;
4020 
4021  if ((bit = clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) != 0) {
4022  if (start == -1) start = j;
4023  }
4024  if (start != -1 && (!bit || j == CLUSTER_SLOTS-1)) {
4025  if (bit && j == CLUSTER_SLOTS-1) j++;
4026 
4027  if (start == j-1) {
4028  ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %d",start);
4029  } else {
4030  ci = sdscatprintf(ci," %d-%d",start,j-1);
4031  }
4032  start = -1;
4033  }
4034  }
4035 
4036  /* Just for MYSELF node we also dump info about slots that
4037  * we are migrating to other instances or importing from other
4038  * instances. */
4039  if (node->flags & CLUSTER_NODE_MYSELF) {
4040  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
4041  if (server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j]) {
4042  ci = sdscatprintf(ci," [%d->-%.40s]",j,
4043  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[j]->name);
4044  } else if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j]) {
4045  ci = sdscatprintf(ci," [%d-<-%.40s]",j,
4046  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j]->name);
4047  }
4048  }
4049  }
4050  return ci;
4051 }
4052 
4053 /* Generate a csv-alike representation of the nodes we are aware of,
4054  * including the "myself" node, and return an SDS string containing the
4055  * representation (it is up to the caller to free it).
4056  *
4057  * All the nodes matching at least one of the node flags specified in
4058  * "filter" are excluded from the output, so using zero as a filter will
4059  * include all the known nodes in the representation, including nodes in
4060  * the HANDSHAKE state.
4061  *
4062  * The representation obtained using this function is used for the output
4063  * of the CLUSTER NODES function, and as format for the cluster
4064  * configuration file (nodes.conf) for a given node. */
4065 sds clusterGenNodesDescription(int filter) {
4066  sds ci = sdsempty(), ni;
4067  dictIterator *di;
4068  dictEntry *de;
4069 
4070  di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
4071  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4072  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
4073 
4074  if (node->flags & filter) continue;
4075  ni = clusterGenNodeDescription(node);
4076  ci = sdscatsds(ci,ni);
4077  sdsfree(ni);
4078  ci = sdscatlen(ci,"\n",1);
4079  }
4080  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4081  return ci;
4082 }
4083 
4084 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4085  * CLUSTER command
4086  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
