4088 const char *clusterGetMessageTypeString(int type) {
4089  switch(type) {
4090  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PING: return "ping";
4091  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PONG: return "pong";
4092  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MEET: return "meet";
4093  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAIL: return "fail";
4094  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_PUBLISH: return "publish";
4095  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_REQUEST: return "auth-req";
4096  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_FAILOVER_AUTH_ACK: return "auth-ack";
4097  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_UPDATE: return "update";
4098  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MFSTART: return "mfstart";
4099  case CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_MODULE: return "module";
4100  }
4101  return "unknown";
4102 }
4103 
4104 int getSlotOrReply(client *c, robj *o) {
4105  long long slot;
4106 
4107  if (getLongLongFromObject(o,&slot) != C_OK ||
4108  slot < 0 || slot >= CLUSTER_SLOTS)
4109  {
4110  addReplyError(c,"Invalid or out of range slot");
4111  return -1;
4112  }
4113  return (int) slot;
4114 }
4115 
4116 void clusterReplyMultiBulkSlots(client *c) {
4117  /* Format: 1) 1) start slot
4118  * 2) end slot
4119  * 3) 1) master IP
4120  * 2) master port
4121  * 3) node ID
4122  * 4) 1) replica IP
4123  * 2) replica port
4124  * 3) node ID
4125  * ... continued until done
4126  */
4127 
4128  int num_masters = 0;
4129  void *slot_replylen = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
4130 
4131  dictEntry *de;
4132  dictIterator *di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.cluster->nodes);
4133  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
4134  clusterNode *node = dictGetVal(de);
4135  int j = 0, start = -1;
4136 
4137  /* Skip slaves (that are iterated when producing the output of their
4138  * master) and masters not serving any slot. */
4139  if (!nodeIsMaster(node) || node->numslots == 0) continue;
4140 
4141  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
4142  int bit, i;
4143 
4144  if ((bit = clusterNodeGetSlotBit(node,j)) != 0) {
4145  if (start == -1) start = j;
4146  }
4147  if (start != -1 && (!bit || j == CLUSTER_SLOTS-1)) {
4148  int nested_elements = 3; /* slots (2) + master addr (1). */
4149  void *nested_replylen = addDeferredMultiBulkLength(c);
4150 
4151  if (bit && j == CLUSTER_SLOTS-1) j++;
4152 
4153  /* If slot exists in output map, add to it's list.
4154  * else, create a new output map for this slot */
4155  if (start == j-1) {
4156  addReplyLongLong(c, start); /* only one slot; low==high */
4157  addReplyLongLong(c, start);
4158  } else {
4159  addReplyLongLong(c, start); /* low */
4160  addReplyLongLong(c, j-1); /* high */
4161  }
4162  start = -1;
4163 
4164  /* First node reply position is always the master */
4165  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c, 3);
4166  addReplyBulkCString(c, node->ip);
4167  addReplyLongLong(c, node->port);
4168  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c, node->name, CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
4169 
4170  /* Remaining nodes in reply are replicas for slot range */
4171  for (i = 0; i < node->numslaves; i++) {
4172  /* This loop is copy/pasted from clusterGenNodeDescription()
4173  * with modifications for per-slot node aggregation */
4174  if (nodeFailed(node->slaves[i])) continue;
4175  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c, 3);
4176  addReplyBulkCString(c, node->slaves[i]->ip);
4177  addReplyLongLong(c, node->slaves[i]->port);
4178  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c, node->slaves[i]->name, CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
4179  nested_elements++;
4180  }
4181  setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c, nested_replylen, nested_elements);
4182  num_masters++;
4183  }
4184  }
4185  }
4186  dictReleaseIterator(di);
4187  setDeferredMultiBulkLength(c, slot_replylen, num_masters);
4188 }
4189 
4190 void clusterCommand(client *c) {
4191  if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
4192  addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
4193  return;
4194  }
4195 
4196  if (c->argc == 2 && !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"help")) {
4197  const char *help[] = {
4198 "ADDSLOTS <slot> [slot ...] -- Assign slots to current node.",
4199 "BUMPEPOCH -- Advance the cluster config epoch.",
4200 "COUNT-failure-reports <node-id> -- Return number of failure reports for <node-id>.",
4201 "COUNTKEYSINSLOT <slot> - Return the number of keys in <slot>.",
4202 "DELSLOTS <slot> [slot ...] -- Delete slots information from current node.",
4203 "FAILOVER [force|takeover] -- Promote current replica node to being a master.",
4204 "FORGET <node-id> -- Remove a node from the cluster.",
4205 "GETKEYSINSLOT <slot> <count> -- Return key names stored by current node in a slot.",
4206 "FLUSHSLOTS -- Delete current node own slots information.",
4207 "INFO - Return onformation about the cluster.",
4208 "KEYSLOT <key> -- Return the hash slot for <key>.",
4209 "MEET <ip> <port> [bus-port] -- Connect nodes into a working cluster.",
4210 "MYID -- Return the node id.",
4211 "NODES -- Return cluster configuration seen by node. Output format:",
4212 " <id> <ip:port> <flags> <master> <pings> <pongs> <epoch> <link> <slot> ... <slot>",
4213 "REPLICATE <node-id> -- Configure current node as replica to <node-id>.",
4214 "RESET [hard|soft] -- Reset current node (default: soft).",
4215 "SET-config-epoch <epoch> - Set config epoch of current node.",
4216 "SETSLOT <slot> (importing|migrating|stable|node <node-id>) -- Set slot state.",
4217 "REPLICAS <node-id> -- Return <node-id> replicas.",
4218 "SLOTS -- Return information about slots range mappings. Each range is made of:",
4219 " start, end, master and replicas IP addresses, ports and ids",
4220 NULL
4221  };
4222  addReplyHelp(c, help);
4223  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"meet") && (c->argc == 4 || c->argc == 5)) {
4224  /* CLUSTER MEET <ip> <port> [cport] */
4225  long long port, cport;
4226 
4227  if (getLongLongFromObject(c->argv[3], &port) != C_OK) {
4228  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid TCP base port specified: %s",
4229  (char*)c->argv[3]->ptr);
4230  return;
4231  }
4232 
4233  if (c->argc == 5) {
4234  if (getLongLongFromObject(c->argv[4], &cport) != C_OK) {
4235  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid TCP bus port specified: %s",
4236  (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
4237  return;
4238  }
4239  } else {
4240  cport = port + CLUSTER_PORT_INCR;
4241  }
4242 
4243  if (clusterStartHandshake(c->argv[2]->ptr,port,cport) == 0 &&
4244  errno == EINVAL)
4245  {
4246  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid node address specified: %s:%s",
4247  (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr, (char*)c->argv[3]->ptr);
4248  } else {
4249  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4250  }
4251  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"nodes") && c->argc == 2) {
4252  /* CLUSTER NODES */
4253  robj *o;
4254  sds ci = clusterGenNodesDescription(0);
4255 
4256  o = createObject(OBJ_STRING,ci);
4257  addReplyBulk(c,o);
4258  decrRefCount(o);
4259  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"myid") && c->argc == 2) {
4260  /* CLUSTER MYID */
4261  addReplyBulkCBuffer(c,myself->name, CLUSTER_NAMELEN);
4262  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slots") && c->argc == 2) {
4263  /* CLUSTER SLOTS */
4264  clusterReplyMultiBulkSlots(c);
4265  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"flushslots") && c->argc == 2) {
4266  /* CLUSTER FLUSHSLOTS */
4267  if (dictSize(server.db[0].dict) != 0) {
4268  addReplyError(c,"DB must be empty to perform CLUSTER FLUSHSLOTS.");
4269  return;
4270  }
4271  clusterDelNodeSlots(myself);
4272  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4273  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4274  } else if ((!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"addslots") ||
4275  !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"delslots")) && c->argc >= 3)
4276  {
4277  /* CLUSTER ADDSLOTS <slot> [slot] ... */
4278  /* CLUSTER DELSLOTS <slot> [slot] ... */
4279  int j, slot;
4280  unsigned char *slots = zmalloc(CLUSTER_SLOTS);
4281  int del = !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"delslots");
4282 
4283  memset(slots,0,CLUSTER_SLOTS);
4284  /* Check that all the arguments are parseable and that all the
4285  * slots are not already busy. */
4286  for (j = 2; j < c->argc; j++) {
4287  if ((slot = getSlotOrReply(c,c->argv[j])) == -1) {
4288  zfree(slots);
4289  return;
4290  }
4291  if (del && server.cluster->slots[slot] == NULL) {
4292  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d is already unassigned", slot);
4293  zfree(slots);
4294  return;
4295  } else if (!del && server.cluster->slots[slot]) {
4296  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d is already busy", slot);
4297  zfree(slots);
4298  return;
4299  }
4300  if (slots[slot]++ == 1) {
4301  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Slot %d specified multiple times",
4302  (int)slot);
4303  zfree(slots);
4304  return;
4305  }
4306  }
4307  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
4308  if (slots[j]) {
4309  int retval;
4310 
4311  /* If this slot was set as importing we can clear this
4312  * state as now we are the real owner of the slot. */
4313  if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j])
4314  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[j] = NULL;
4315 
4316  retval = del ? clusterDelSlot(j) :
4317  clusterAddSlot(myself,j);
4318  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,retval == C_OK);
4319  }
4320  }
4321  zfree(slots);
4322  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4323  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4324  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"setslot") && c->argc >= 4) {
4325  /* SETSLOT 10 MIGRATING <node ID> */
4326  /* SETSLOT 10 IMPORTING <node ID> */
4327  /* SETSLOT 10 STABLE */
4328  /* SETSLOT 10 NODE <node ID> */
4329  int slot;
4330  clusterNode *n;
4331 
4332  if (nodeIsSlave(myself)) {
4333  addReplyError(c,"Please use SETSLOT only with masters.");
4334  return;
4335  }
4336 
4337  if ((slot = getSlotOrReply(c,c->argv[2])) == -1) return;
4338 
4339  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"migrating") && c->argc == 5) {
4340  if (server.cluster->slots[slot] != myself) {
4341  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I'm not the owner of hash slot %u",slot);
4342  return;
4343  }
4344  if ((n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr)) == NULL) {
4345  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I don't know about node %s",
4346  (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
4347  return;
4348  }
4349  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = n;
4350  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"importing") && c->argc == 5) {
4351  if (server.cluster->slots[slot] == myself) {
4352  addReplyErrorFormat(c,
4353  "I'm already the owner of hash slot %u",slot);
4354  return;
4355  }
4356  if ((n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr)) == NULL) {
4357  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"I don't know about node %s",
4358  (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
4359  return;
4360  }
4361  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = n;
4362  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"stable") && c->argc == 4) {
4363  /* CLUSTER SETSLOT <SLOT> STABLE */
4364  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = NULL;
4365  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = NULL;
4366  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[3]->ptr,"node") && c->argc == 5) {
4367  /* CLUSTER SETSLOT <SLOT> NODE <NODE ID> */
4368  clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[4]->ptr);
4369 
4370  if (!n) {
4371  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s",
4372  (char*)c->argv[4]->ptr);
4373  return;
4374  }
4375  /* If this hash slot was served by 'myself' before to switch
4376  * make sure there are no longer local keys for this hash slot. */
4377  if (server.cluster->slots[slot] == myself && n != myself) {
4378  if (countKeysInSlot(slot) != 0) {
4379  addReplyErrorFormat(c,
4380  "Can't assign hashslot %d to a different node "
4381  "while I still hold keys for this hash slot.", slot);
4382  return;
4383  }
4384  }
4385  /* If this slot is in migrating status but we have no keys
4386  * for it assigning the slot to another node will clear
4387  * the migratig status. */
4388  if (countKeysInSlot(slot) == 0 &&
4389  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot])
4390  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] = NULL;
4391 
4392  /* If this node was importing this slot, assigning the slot to
4393  * itself also clears the importing status. */
4394  if (n == myself &&
4395  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot])
4396  {
4397  /* This slot was manually migrated, set this node configEpoch
4398  * to a new epoch so that the new version can be propagated
4399  * by the cluster.
4400  *
4401  * Note that if this ever results in a collision with another
4402  * node getting the same configEpoch, for example because a
4403  * failover happens at the same time we close the slot, the
4404  * configEpoch collision resolution will fix it assigning
4405  * a different epoch to each node. */
4406  if (clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus() == C_OK) {
4407  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
4408  "configEpoch updated after importing slot %d", slot);
4409  }
4410  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] = NULL;
4411  }
4412  clusterDelSlot(slot);
4413  clusterAddSlot(n,slot);
4414  } else {
4415  addReplyError(c,
4416  "Invalid CLUSTER SETSLOT action or number of arguments. Try CLUSTER HELP");
4417  return;
4418  }
4419  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG|CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE);
4420  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4421  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"bumpepoch") && c->argc == 2) {
4422  /* CLUSTER BUMPEPOCH */
4423  int retval = clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus();
4424  sds reply = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"+%s %llu\r\n",
4425  (retval == C_OK) ? "BUMPED" : "STILL",
4426  (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
4427  addReplySds(c,reply);
4428  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"info") && c->argc == 2) {
4429  /* CLUSTER INFO */
4430  char *statestr[] = {"ok","fail","needhelp"};
4431  int slots_assigned = 0, slots_ok = 0, slots_pfail = 0, slots_fail = 0;
4432  uint64_t myepoch;
4433  int j;
4434 
4435  for (j = 0; j < CLUSTER_SLOTS; j++) {
4436  clusterNode *n = server.cluster->slots[j];
4437 
4438  if (n == NULL) continue;
4439  slots_assigned++;
4440  if (nodeFailed(n)) {
4441  slots_fail++;
4442  } else if (nodeTimedOut(n)) {
4443  slots_pfail++;
4444  } else {
4445  slots_ok++;
4446  }
4447  }
4448 
4449  myepoch = (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof) ?
4450  myself->slaveof->configEpoch : myself->configEpoch;
4451 
4452  sds info = sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
4453  "cluster_state:%s\r\n"
4454  "cluster_slots_assigned:%d\r\n"
4455  "cluster_slots_ok:%d\r\n"
4456  "cluster_slots_pfail:%d\r\n"
4457  "cluster_slots_fail:%d\r\n"
4458  "cluster_known_nodes:%lu\r\n"
4459  "cluster_size:%d\r\n"
4460  "cluster_current_epoch:%llu\r\n"
4461  "cluster_my_epoch:%llu\r\n"
4462  , statestr[server.cluster->state],
4463  slots_assigned,
4464  slots_ok,
4465  slots_pfail,
4466  slots_fail,
4467  dictSize(server.cluster->nodes),
4468  server.cluster->size,
4469  (unsigned long long) server.cluster->currentEpoch,
4470  (unsigned long long) myepoch
4471  );
4472 
4473  /* Show stats about messages sent and received. */
4474  long long tot_msg_sent = 0;
4475  long long tot_msg_received = 0;
4476 
4477  for (int i = 0; i < CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_COUNT; i++) {
4478  if (server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent[i] == 0) continue;
4479  tot_msg_sent += server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent[i];
4480  info = sdscatprintf(info,
4481  "cluster_stats_messages_%s_sent:%lld\r\n",
4482  clusterGetMessageTypeString(i),
4483  server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_sent[i]);
4484  }
4485  info = sdscatprintf(info,
4486  "cluster_stats_messages_sent:%lld\r\n", tot_msg_sent);
4487 
4488  for (int i = 0; i < CLUSTERMSG_TYPE_COUNT; i++) {
4489  if (server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received[i] == 0) continue;
4490  tot_msg_received += server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received[i];
4491  info = sdscatprintf(info,
4492  "cluster_stats_messages_%s_received:%lld\r\n",
4493  clusterGetMessageTypeString(i),
4494  server.cluster->stats_bus_messages_received[i]);
4495  }
4496  info = sdscatprintf(info,
4497  "cluster_stats_messages_received:%lld\r\n", tot_msg_received);
4498 
4499  /* Produce the reply protocol. */
4500  addReplySds(c,sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),"$%lu\r\n",
4501  (unsigned long)sdslen(info)));
4502  addReplySds(c,info);
4503  addReply(c,shared.crlf);
4504  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"saveconfig") && c->argc == 2) {
4505  int retval = clusterSaveConfig(1);
4506 
4507  if (retval == 0)
4508  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4509  else
4510  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"error saving the cluster node config: %s",
4511  strerror(errno));
4512  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"keyslot") && c->argc == 3) {
4513  /* CLUSTER KEYSLOT <key> */
4514  sds key = c->argv[2]->ptr;
4515 
4516  addReplyLongLong(c,keyHashSlot(key,sdslen(key)));
4517  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"countkeysinslot") && c->argc == 3) {
4518  /* CLUSTER COUNTKEYSINSLOT <slot> */
4519  long long slot;
4520 
4521  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&slot,NULL) != C_OK)
4522  return;
4523  if (slot < 0 || slot >= CLUSTER_SLOTS) {
4524  addReplyError(c,"Invalid slot");
4525  return;
4526  }
4527  addReplyLongLong(c,countKeysInSlot(slot));
4528  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"getkeysinslot") && c->argc == 4) {
4529  /* CLUSTER GETKEYSINSLOT <slot> <count> */
4530  long long maxkeys, slot;
4531  unsigned int numkeys, j;
4532  robj **keys;
4533 
4534  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&slot,NULL) != C_OK)
4535  return;
4536  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[3],&maxkeys,NULL)
4537  != C_OK)
4538  return;
4539  if (slot < 0 || slot >= CLUSTER_SLOTS || maxkeys < 0) {
4540  addReplyError(c,"Invalid slot or number of keys");
4541  return;
4542  }
4543 
4544  /* Avoid allocating more than needed in case of large COUNT argument
4545  * and smaller actual number of keys. */
4546  unsigned int keys_in_slot = countKeysInSlot(slot);
4547  if (maxkeys > keys_in_slot) maxkeys = keys_in_slot;
4548 
4549  keys = zmalloc(sizeof(robj*)*maxkeys);
4550  numkeys = getKeysInSlot(slot, keys, maxkeys);
4551  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,numkeys);
4552  for (j = 0; j < numkeys; j++) {
4553  addReplyBulk(c,keys[j]);
4554  decrRefCount(keys[j]);
4555  }
4556  zfree(keys);
4557  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"forget") && c->argc == 3) {
4558  /* CLUSTER FORGET <NODE ID> */
4559  clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4560 
4561  if (!n) {
4562  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4563  return;
4564  } else if (n == myself) {
4565  addReplyError(c,"I tried hard but I can't forget myself...");
4566  return;
4567  } else if (nodeIsSlave(myself) && myself->slaveof == n) {
4568  addReplyError(c,"Can't forget my master!");
4569  return;
4570  }
4571  clusterBlacklistAddNode(n);
4572  clusterDelNode(n);
4573  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
4574  CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4575  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4576  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"replicate") && c->argc == 3) {
4577  /* CLUSTER REPLICATE <NODE ID> */
4578  clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4579 
4580  /* Lookup the specified node in our table. */
4581  if (!n) {
4582  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4583  return;
4584  }
4585 
4586  /* I can't replicate myself. */
4587  if (n == myself) {
4588  addReplyError(c,"Can't replicate myself");
4589  return;
4590  }
4591 
4592  /* Can't replicate a slave. */
4593  if (nodeIsSlave(n)) {
4594  addReplyError(c,"I can only replicate a master, not a replica.");
4595  return;
4596  }
4597 
4598  /* If the instance is currently a master, it should have no assigned
4599  * slots nor keys to accept to replicate some other node.
4600  * Slaves can switch to another master without issues. */
4601  if (nodeIsMaster(myself) &&
4602  (myself->numslots != 0 || dictSize(server.db[0].dict) != 0)) {
4603  addReplyError(c,
4604  "To set a master the node must be empty and "
4605  "without assigned slots.");
4606  return;
4607  }
4608 
4609  /* Set the master. */
4610  clusterSetMaster(n);
4611  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4612  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4613  } else if ((!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"slaves") ||
4614  !strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"replicas")) && c->argc == 3) {
4615  /* CLUSTER SLAVES <NODE ID> */
4616  clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4617  int j;
4618 
4619  /* Lookup the specified node in our table. */
4620  if (!n) {
4621  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4622  return;
4623  }
4624 
4625  if (nodeIsSlave(n)) {
4626  addReplyError(c,"The specified node is not a master");
4627  return;
4628  }
4629 
4630  addReplyMultiBulkLen(c,n->numslaves);
4631  for (j = 0; j < n->numslaves; j++) {
4632  sds ni = clusterGenNodeDescription(n->slaves[j]);
4633  addReplyBulkCString(c,ni);
4634  sdsfree(ni);
4635  }
4636  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"count-failure-reports") &&
4637  c->argc == 3)
4638  {
4639  /* CLUSTER COUNT-FAILURE-REPORTS <NODE ID> */
4640  clusterNode *n = clusterLookupNode(c->argv[2]->ptr);
4641 
4642  if (!n) {
4643  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Unknown node %s", (char*)c->argv[2]->ptr);
4644  return;
4645  } else {
4646  addReplyLongLong(c,clusterNodeFailureReportsCount(n));
4647  }
4648  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"failover") &&
4649  (c->argc == 2 || c->argc == 3))
4650  {
4651  /* CLUSTER FAILOVER [FORCE|TAKEOVER] */
4652  int force = 0, takeover = 0;
4653 
4654  if (c->argc == 3) {
4655  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"force")) {
4656  force = 1;
4657  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"takeover")) {
4658  takeover = 1;
4659  force = 1; /* Takeover also implies force. */
4660  } else {
4661  addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4662  return;
4663  }
4664  }
4665 
4666  /* Check preconditions. */
4667  if (nodeIsMaster(myself)) {
4668  addReplyError(c,"You should send CLUSTER FAILOVER to a replica");
4669  return;
4670  } else if (myself->slaveof == NULL) {
4671  addReplyError(c,"I'm a replica but my master is unknown to me");
4672  return;
4673  } else if (!force &&
4674  (nodeFailed(myself->slaveof) ||
4675  myself->slaveof->link == NULL))
4676  {
4677  addReplyError(c,"Master is down or failed, "
4678  "please use CLUSTER FAILOVER FORCE");
4679  return;
4680  }
4681  resetManualFailover();
4682  server.cluster->mf_end = mstime() + CLUSTER_MF_TIMEOUT;
4683 
4684  if (takeover) {
4685  /* A takeover does not perform any initial check. It just
4686  * generates a new configuration epoch for this node without
4687  * consensus, claims the master's slots, and broadcast the new
4688  * configuration. */
4689  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Taking over the master (user request).");
4690  clusterBumpConfigEpochWithoutConsensus();
4691  clusterFailoverReplaceYourMaster();
4692  } else if (force) {
4693  /* If this is a forced failover, we don't need to talk with our
4694  * master to agree about the offset. We just failover taking over
4695  * it without coordination. */
4696  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Forced failover user request accepted.");
4697  server.cluster->mf_can_start = 1;
4698  } else {
4699  serverLog(LL_WARNING,"Manual failover user request accepted.");
4700  clusterSendMFStart(myself->slaveof);
4701  }
4702  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4703  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"set-config-epoch") && c->argc == 3)
4704  {
4705  /* CLUSTER SET-CONFIG-EPOCH <epoch>
4706  *
4707  * The user is allowed to set the config epoch only when a node is
4708  * totally fresh: no config epoch, no other known node, and so forth.
4709  * This happens at cluster creation time to start with a cluster where
4710  * every node has a different node ID, without to rely on the conflicts
4711  * resolution system which is too slow when a big cluster is created. */
4712  long long epoch;
4713 
4714  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&epoch,NULL) != C_OK)
4715  return;
4716 
4717  if (epoch < 0) {
4718  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Invalid config epoch specified: %lld",epoch);
4719  } else if (dictSize(server.cluster->nodes) > 1) {
4720  addReplyError(c,"The user can assign a config epoch only when the "
4721  "node does not know any other node.");
4722  } else if (myself->configEpoch != 0) {
4723  addReplyError(c,"Node config epoch is already non-zero");
4724  } else {
4725  myself->configEpoch = epoch;
4726  serverLog(LL_WARNING,
4727  "configEpoch set to %llu via CLUSTER SET-CONFIG-EPOCH",
4728  (unsigned long long) myself->configEpoch);
4729 
4730  if (server.cluster->currentEpoch < (uint64_t)epoch)
4731  server.cluster->currentEpoch = epoch;
4732  /* No need to fsync the config here since in the unlucky event
4733  * of a failure to persist the config, the conflict resolution code
4734  * will assign an unique config to this node. */
4735  clusterDoBeforeSleep(CLUSTER_TODO_UPDATE_STATE|
4736  CLUSTER_TODO_SAVE_CONFIG);
4737  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4738  }
4739  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[1]->ptr,"reset") &&
4740  (c->argc == 2 || c->argc == 3))
4741  {
4742  /* CLUSTER RESET [SOFT|HARD] */
4743  int hard = 0;
4744 
4745  /* Parse soft/hard argument. Default is soft. */
4746  if (c->argc == 3) {
4747  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"hard")) {
4748  hard = 1;
4749  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[2]->ptr,"soft")) {
4750  hard = 0;
4751  } else {
4752  addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4753  return;
4754  }
4755  }
4756 
4757  /* Slaves can be reset while containing data, but not master nodes
4758  * that must be empty. */
4759  if (nodeIsMaster(myself) && dictSize(c->db->dict) != 0) {
4760  addReplyError(c,"CLUSTER RESET can't be called with "
4761  "master nodes containing keys");
4762  return;
4763  }
4764  clusterReset(hard);
4765  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4766  } else {
4767  addReplySubcommandSyntaxError(c);
4768  return;
4769  }
4770 }
4771 
4772 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4773  * DUMP, RESTORE and MIGRATE commands
4774  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
4775 
4776 /* Generates a DUMP-format representation of the object 'o', adding it to the
4777  * io stream pointed by 'rio'. This function can't fail. */
4778 void createDumpPayload(rio *payload, robj *o) {
4779  unsigned char buf[2];
4780  uint64_t crc;
4781 
4782  /* Serialize the object in a RDB-like format. It consist of an object type
4783  * byte followed by the serialized object. This is understood by RESTORE. */
4784  rioInitWithBuffer(payload,sdsempty());
4785  serverAssert(rdbSaveObjectType(payload,o));
4786  serverAssert(rdbSaveObject(payload,o));
4787 
4788  /* Write the footer, this is how it looks like:
4789  * ----------------+---------------------+---------------+
4790  * ... RDB payload | 2 bytes RDB version | 8 bytes CRC64 |
4791  * ----------------+---------------------+---------------+
4792  * RDB version and CRC are both in little endian.
4793  */
4794 
4795  /* RDB version */
4796  buf[0] = RDB_VERSION & 0xff;
4797  buf[1] = (RDB_VERSION >> 8) & 0xff;
4798  payload->io.buffer.ptr = sdscatlen(payload->io.buffer.ptr,buf,2);
4799 
4800  /* CRC64 */
4801  crc = crc64(0,(unsigned char*)payload->io.buffer.ptr,
4802  sdslen(payload->io.buffer.ptr));
4803  memrev64ifbe(&crc);
4804  payload->io.buffer.ptr = sdscatlen(payload->io.buffer.ptr,&crc,8);
4805 }
4806 
4807 /* Verify that the RDB version of the dump payload matches the one of this Redis
4808  * instance and that the checksum is ok.
4809  * If the DUMP payload looks valid C_OK is returned, otherwise C_ERR
4810  * is returned. */
4811 int verifyDumpPayload(unsigned char *p, size_t len) {
4812  unsigned char *footer;
4813  uint16_t rdbver;
4814  uint64_t crc;
4815 
4816  /* At least 2 bytes of RDB version and 8 of CRC64 should be present. */
4817  if (len < 10) return C_ERR;
4818  footer = p+(len-10);
4819 
4820  /* Verify RDB version */
4821  rdbver = (footer[1] << 8) | footer[0];
4822  if (rdbver > RDB_VERSION) return C_ERR;
4823 
4824  /* Verify CRC64 */
4825  crc = crc64(0,p,len-8);
4826  memrev64ifbe(&crc);
4827  return (memcmp(&crc,footer+2,8) == 0) ? C_OK : C_ERR;
4828 }
4829 
4830 /* DUMP keyname
4831  * DUMP is actually not used by Redis Cluster but it is the obvious
4832  * complement of RESTORE and can be useful for different applications. */
4833 void dumpCommand(client *c) {
4834  robj *o, *dumpobj;
4835  rio payload;
4836 
4837  /* Check if the key is here. */
4838  if ((o = lookupKeyRead(c->db,c->argv[1])) == NULL) {
4839  addReply(c,shared.nullbulk);
4840  return;
4841  }
4842 
4843  /* Create the DUMP encoded representation. */
4844  createDumpPayload(&payload,o);
4845 
4846  /* Transfer to the client */
4847  dumpobj = createObject(OBJ_STRING,payload.io.buffer.ptr);
4848  addReplyBulk(c,dumpobj);
4849  decrRefCount(dumpobj);
4850  return;
4851 }
4852 
4853 /* RESTORE key ttl serialized-value [REPLACE] */
4854 void restoreCommand(client *c) {
4855  long long ttl, lfu_freq = -1, lru_idle = -1, lru_clock = -1;
4856  rio payload;
4857  int j, type, replace = 0, absttl = 0;
4858  robj *obj;
4859 
4860  /* Parse additional options */
4861  for (j = 4; j < c->argc; j++) {
4862  int additional = c->argc-j-1;
4863  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"replace")) {
4864  replace = 1;
4865  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"absttl")) {
4866  absttl = 1;
4867  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"idletime") && additional >= 1 &&
4868  lfu_freq == -1)
4869  {
4870  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[j+1],&lru_idle,NULL)
4871  != C_OK) return;
4872  if (lru_idle < 0) {
4873  addReplyError(c,"Invalid IDLETIME value, must be >= 0");
4874  return;
4875  }
4876  lru_clock = LRU_CLOCK();
4877  j++; /* Consume additional arg. */
4878  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"freq") && additional >= 1 &&
4879  lru_idle == -1)
4880  {
4881  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[j+1],&lfu_freq,NULL)
4882  != C_OK) return;
4883  if (lfu_freq < 0 || lfu_freq > 255) {
4884  addReplyError(c,"Invalid FREQ value, must be >= 0 and <= 255");
4885  return;
4886  }
4887  j++; /* Consume additional arg. */
4888  } else {
4889  addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
4890  return;
4891  }
4892  }
4893 
4894  /* Make sure this key does not already exist here... */
4895  if (!replace && lookupKeyWrite(c->db,c->argv[1]) != NULL) {
4896  addReply(c,shared.busykeyerr);
4897  return;
4898  }
4899 
4900  /* Check if the TTL value makes sense */
4901  if (getLongLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[2],&ttl,NULL) != C_OK) {
4902  return;
4903  } else if (ttl < 0) {
4904  addReplyError(c,"Invalid TTL value, must be >= 0");
4905  return;
4906  }
4907 
4908  /* Verify RDB version and data checksum. */
4909  if (verifyDumpPayload(c->argv[3]->ptr,sdslen(c->argv[3]->ptr)) == C_ERR)
4910  {
4911  addReplyError(c,"DUMP payload version or checksum are wrong");
4912  return;
4913  }
4914 
4915  rioInitWithBuffer(&payload,c->argv[3]->ptr);
4916  if (((type = rdbLoadObjectType(&payload)) == -1) ||
4917  ((obj = rdbLoadObject(type,&payload)) == NULL))
4918  {
4919  addReplyError(c,"Bad data format");
4920  return;
4921  }
4922 
4923  /* Remove the old key if needed. */
4924  if (replace) dbDelete(c->db,c->argv[1]);
4925 
4926  /* Create the key and set the TTL if any */
4927  dbAdd(c->db,c->argv[1],obj);
4928  if (ttl) {
4929  if (!absttl) ttl+=mstime();
4930  setExpire(c,c->db,c->argv[1],ttl);
4931  }
4932  objectSetLRUOrLFU(obj,lfu_freq,lru_idle,lru_clock);
4933  signalModifiedKey(c->db,c->argv[1]);
4934  addReply(c,shared.ok);
4935  server.dirty++;
4936 }
4937 
4938 /* MIGRATE socket cache implementation.
4939  *
4940  * We take a map between host:ip and a TCP socket that we used to connect
4941  * to this instance in recent time.
4942  * This sockets are closed when the max number we cache is reached, and also
4943  * in serverCron() when they are around for more than a few seconds. */
4944 #define MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_ITEMS 64 /* max num of items in the cache. */
4945 #define MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_TTL 10 /* close cached sockets after 10 sec. */
4946 
4947 typedef struct migrateCachedSocket {
4948  int fd;
4949  long last_dbid;
4950  time_t last_use_time;
4951 } migrateCachedSocket;
4952 
4953 /* Return a migrateCachedSocket containing a TCP socket connected with the
4954  * target instance, possibly returning a cached one.
4955  *
4956  * This function is responsible of sending errors to the client if a
4957  * connection can't be established. In this case -1 is returned.
4958  * Otherwise on success the socket is returned, and the caller should not
4959  * attempt to free it after usage.
4960  *
4961  * If the caller detects an error while using the socket, migrateCloseSocket()
4962  * should be called so that the connection will be created from scratch
4963  * the next time. */
4964 migrateCachedSocket* migrateGetSocket(client *c, robj *host, robj *port, long timeout) {
4965  int fd;
4966  sds name = sdsempty();
4967  migrateCachedSocket *cs;
4968 
4969  /* Check if we have an already cached socket for this ip:port pair. */
4970  name = sdscatlen(name,host->ptr,sdslen(host->ptr));
4971  name = sdscatlen(name,":",1);
4972  name = sdscatlen(name,port->ptr,sdslen(port->ptr));
4973  cs = dictFetchValue(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
4974  if (cs) {
4975  sdsfree(name);
4976  cs->last_use_time = server.unixtime;
4977  return cs;
4978  }
4979 
4980  /* No cached socket, create one. */
4981  if (dictSize(server.migrate_cached_sockets) == MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_ITEMS) {
4982  /* Too many items, drop one at random. */
4983  dictEntry *de = dictGetRandomKey(server.migrate_cached_sockets);
4984  cs = dictGetVal(de);
4985  close(cs->fd);
4986  zfree(cs);
4987  dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,dictGetKey(de));
4988  }
4989 
4990  /* Create the socket */
4991  fd = anetTcpNonBlockConnect(server.neterr,c->argv[1]->ptr,
4992  atoi(c->argv[2]->ptr));
4993  if (fd == -1) {
4994  sdsfree(name);
4995  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Can't connect to target node: %s",
4996  server.neterr);
4997  return NULL;
4998  }
4999  anetEnableTcpNoDelay(server.neterr,fd);
5000 
5001  /* Check if it connects within the specified timeout. */
5002  if ((aeWait(fd,AE_WRITABLE,timeout) & AE_WRITABLE) == 0) {
5003  sdsfree(name);
5004  addReplySds(c,
5005  sdsnew("-IOERR error or timeout connecting to the client\r\n"));
5006  close(fd);
5007  return NULL;
5008  }
5009 
5010  /* Add to the cache and return it to the caller. */
5011  cs = zmalloc(sizeof(*cs));
5012  cs->fd = fd;
5013  cs->last_dbid = -1;
5014  cs->last_use_time = server.unixtime;
5015  dictAdd(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name,cs);
5016  return cs;
5017 }
5018 
5019 /* Free a migrate cached connection. */
5020 void migrateCloseSocket(robj *host, robj *port) {
5021  sds name = sdsempty();
5022  migrateCachedSocket *cs;
5023 
5024  name = sdscatlen(name,host->ptr,sdslen(host->ptr));
5025  name = sdscatlen(name,":",1);
5026  name = sdscatlen(name,port->ptr,sdslen(port->ptr));
5027  cs = dictFetchValue(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
5028  if (!cs) {
5029  sdsfree(name);
5030  return;
5031  }
5032 
5033  close(cs->fd);
5034  zfree(cs);
5035  dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,name);
5036  sdsfree(name);
5037 }
5038 
5039 void migrateCloseTimedoutSockets(void) {
5040  dictIterator *di = dictGetSafeIterator(server.migrate_cached_sockets);
5041  dictEntry *de;
5042 
5043  while((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
5044  migrateCachedSocket *cs = dictGetVal(de);
5045 
5046  if ((server.unixtime - cs->last_use_time) > MIGRATE_SOCKET_CACHE_TTL) {
5047  close(cs->fd);
5048  zfree(cs);
5049  dictDelete(server.migrate_cached_sockets,dictGetKey(de));
5050  }
5051  }
5052  dictReleaseIterator(di);
5053 }
5054 
5055 /* MIGRATE host port key dbid timeout [COPY | REPLACE | AUTH password]
5056  *
5057  * On in the multiple keys form:
5058  *
5059  * MIGRATE host port "" dbid timeout [COPY | REPLACE | AUTH password] KEYS key1
5060  * key2 ... keyN */
5061 void migrateCommand(client *c) {
5062  migrateCachedSocket *cs;
5063  int copy = 0, replace = 0, j;
5064  char *password = NULL;
5065  long timeout;
5066  long dbid;
5067  robj **ov = NULL; /* Objects to migrate. */
5068  robj **kv = NULL; /* Key names. */
5069  robj **newargv = NULL; /* Used to rewrite the command as DEL ... keys ... */
5070  rio cmd, payload;
5071  int may_retry = 1;
5072  int write_error = 0;
5073  int argv_rewritten = 0;
5074 
5075  /* To support the KEYS option we need the following additional state. */
5076  int first_key = 3; /* Argument index of the first key. */
5077  int num_keys = 1; /* By default only migrate the 'key' argument. */
5078 
5079  /* Parse additional options */
5080  for (j = 6; j < c->argc; j++) {
5081  int moreargs = j < c->argc-1;
5082  if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"copy")) {
5083  copy = 1;
5084  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"replace")) {
5085  replace = 1;
5086  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"auth")) {
5087  if (!moreargs) {
5088  addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
5089  return;
5090  }
5091  j++;
5092  password = c->argv[j]->ptr;
5093  } else if (!strcasecmp(c->argv[j]->ptr,"keys")) {
5094  if (sdslen(c->argv[3]->ptr) != 0) {
5095  addReplyError(c,
5096  "When using MIGRATE KEYS option, the key argument"
5097  " must be set to the empty string");
5098  return;
5099  }
5100  first_key = j+1;
5101  num_keys = c->argc - j - 1;
5102  break; /* All the remaining args are keys. */
5103  } else {
5104  addReply(c,shared.syntaxerr);
5105  return;
5106  }
5107  }
5108 
5109  /* Sanity check */
5110  if (getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[5],&timeout,NULL) != C_OK ||
5111  getLongFromObjectOrReply(c,c->argv[4],&dbid,NULL) != C_OK)
5112  {
5113  return;
5114  }
5115  if (timeout <= 0) timeout = 1000;
5116 
5117  /* Check if the keys are here. If at least one key is to migrate, do it
5118  * otherwise if all the keys are missing reply with "NOKEY" to signal
5119  * the caller there was nothing to migrate. We don't return an error in
5120  * this case, since often this is due to a normal condition like the key
5121  * expiring in the meantime. */
5122  ov = zrealloc(ov,sizeof(robj*)*num_keys);
5123  kv = zrealloc(kv,sizeof(robj*)*num_keys);
5124  int oi = 0;
5125 
5126  for (j = 0; j < num_keys; j++) {
5127  if ((ov[oi] = lookupKeyRead(c->db,c->argv[first_key+j])) != NULL) {
5128  kv[oi] = c->argv[first_key+j];
5129  oi++;
5130  }
5131  }
5132  num_keys = oi;
5133  if (num_keys == 0) {
5134  zfree(ov); zfree(kv);
5135  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("+NOKEY\r\n"));
5136  return;
5137  }
5138 
5139 try_again:
5140  write_error = 0;
5141 
5142  /* Connect */
5143  cs = migrateGetSocket(c,c->argv[1],c->argv[2],timeout);
5144  if (cs == NULL) {
5145  zfree(ov); zfree(kv);
5146  return; /* error sent to the client by migrateGetSocket() */
5147  }
5148 
5149  rioInitWithBuffer(&cmd,sdsempty());
5150 
5151  /* Authentication */
5152  if (password) {
5153  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkCount(&cmd,'*',2));
5154  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"AUTH",4));
5155  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,password,
5156  sdslen(password)));
5157  }
5158 
5159  /* Send the SELECT command if the current DB is not already selected. */
5160  int select = cs->last_dbid != dbid; /* Should we emit SELECT? */
5161  if (select) {
5162  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkCount(&cmd,'*',2));
5163  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"SELECT",6));
5164  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkLongLong(&cmd,dbid));
5165  }
5166 
5167  int expired = 0; /* Number of keys that we'll find already expired.
5168  Note that serializing large keys may take some time
5169  so certain keys that were found non expired by the
5170  lookupKey() function, may be expired later. */
5171 
5172  /* Create RESTORE payload and generate the protocol to call the command. */
5173  for (j = 0; j < num_keys; j++) {
5174  long long ttl = 0;
5175  long long expireat = getExpire(c->db,kv[j]);
5176 
5177  if (expireat != -1) {
5178  ttl = expireat-mstime();
5179  if (ttl < 0) {
5180  expired++;
5181  continue;
5182  }
5183  if (ttl < 1) ttl = 1;
5184  }
5185  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,
5186  rioWriteBulkCount(&cmd,'*',replace ? 5 : 4));
5187 
5188  if (server.cluster_enabled)
5189  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,
5190  rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"RESTORE-ASKING",14));
5191  else
5192  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"RESTORE",7));
5193  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,sdsEncodedObject(kv[j]));
5194  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,kv[j]->ptr,
5195  sdslen(kv[j]->ptr)));
5196  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkLongLong(&cmd,ttl));
5197 
5198  /* Emit the payload argument, that is the serialized object using
5199  * the DUMP format. */
5200  createDumpPayload(&payload,ov[j]);
5201  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,
5202  rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,payload.io.buffer.ptr,
5203  sdslen(payload.io.buffer.ptr)));
5204  sdsfree(payload.io.buffer.ptr);
5205 
5206  /* Add the REPLACE option to the RESTORE command if it was specified
5207  * as a MIGRATE option. */
5208  if (replace)
5209  serverAssertWithInfo(c,NULL,rioWriteBulkString(&cmd,"REPLACE",7));
5210  }
5211 
5212  /* Transfer the query to the other node in 64K chunks. */
5213  errno = 0;
5214  {
5215  sds buf = cmd.io.buffer.ptr;
5216  size_t pos = 0, towrite;
5217  int nwritten = 0;
5218 
5219  while ((towrite = sdslen(buf)-pos) > 0) {
5220  towrite = (towrite > (64*1024) ? (64*1024) : towrite);
5221  nwritten = syncWrite(cs->fd,buf+pos,towrite,timeout);
5222  if (nwritten != (signed)towrite) {
5223  write_error = 1;
5224  goto socket_err;
5225  }
5226  pos += nwritten;
5227  }
5228  }
5229 
5230  char buf0[1024]; /* Auth reply. */
5231  char buf1[1024]; /* Select reply. */
5232  char buf2[1024]; /* Restore reply. */
5233 
5234  /* Read the AUTH reply if needed. */
5235  if (password && syncReadLine(cs->fd, buf0, sizeof(buf0), timeout) <= 0)
5236  goto socket_err;
5237 
5238  /* Read the SELECT reply if needed. */
5239  if (select && syncReadLine(cs->fd, buf1, sizeof(buf1), timeout) <= 0)
5240  goto socket_err;
5241 
5242  /* Read the RESTORE replies. */
5243  int error_from_target = 0;
5244  int socket_error = 0;
5245  int del_idx = 1; /* Index of the key argument for the replicated DEL op. */
5246 
5247  /* Allocate the new argument vector that will replace the current command,
5248  * to propagate the MIGRATE as a DEL command (if no COPY option was given).
5249  * We allocate num_keys+1 because the additional argument is for "DEL"
5250  * command name itself. */
5251  if (!copy) newargv = zmalloc(sizeof(robj*)*(num_keys+1));
5252 
5253  for (j = 0; j < num_keys-expired; j++) {
5254  if (syncReadLine(cs->fd, buf2, sizeof(buf2), timeout) <= 0) {
5255  socket_error = 1;
5256  break;
5257  }
5258  if ((password && buf0[0] == '-') ||
5259  (select && buf1[0] == '-') ||
5260  buf2[0] == '-')
5261  {
5262  /* On error assume that last_dbid is no longer valid. */
5263  if (!error_from_target) {
5264  cs->last_dbid = -1;
5265  char *errbuf;
5266  if (password && buf0[0] == '-') errbuf = buf0;
5267  else if (select && buf1[0] == '-') errbuf = buf1;
5268  else errbuf = buf2;
5269 
5270  error_from_target = 1;
5271  addReplyErrorFormat(c,"Target instance replied with error: %s",
5272  errbuf+1);
5273  }
5274  } else {
5275  if (!copy) {
5276  /* No COPY option: remove the local key, signal the change. */
5277  dbDelete(c->db,kv[j]);
5278  signalModifiedKey(c->db,kv[j]);
5279  server.dirty++;
5280 
5281  /* Populate the argument vector to replace the old one. */
5282  newargv[del_idx++] = kv[j];
5283  incrRefCount(kv[j]);
5284  }
5285  }
5286  }
5287 
5288  /* On socket error, if we want to retry, do it now before rewriting the
5289  * command vector. We only retry if we are sure nothing was processed
5290  * and we failed to read the first reply (j == 0 test). */
5291  if (!error_from_target && socket_error && j == 0 && may_retry &&
5292  errno != ETIMEDOUT)
5293  {
5294  goto socket_err; /* A retry is guaranteed because of tested conditions.*/
5295  }
5296 
5297  /* On socket errors, close the migration socket now that we still have
5298  * the original host/port in the ARGV. Later the original command may be
5299  * rewritten to DEL and will be too later. */
5300  if (socket_error) migrateCloseSocket(c->argv[1],c->argv[2]);
5301 
5302  if (!copy) {
5303  /* Translate MIGRATE as DEL for replication/AOF. Note that we do
5304  * this only for the keys for which we received an acknowledgement
5305  * from the receiving Redis server, by using the del_idx index. */
5306  if (del_idx > 1) {
5307  newargv[0] = createStringObject("DEL",3);
5308  /* Note that the following call takes ownership of newargv. */
5309  replaceClientCommandVector(c,del_idx,newargv);
5310  argv_rewritten = 1;
5311  } else {
5312  /* No key transfer acknowledged, no need to rewrite as DEL. */
5313  zfree(newargv);
5314  }
5315  newargv = NULL; /* Make it safe to call zfree() on it in the future. */
5316  }
5317 
5318  /* If we are here and a socket error happened, we don't want to retry.
5319  * Just signal the problem to the client, but only do it if we did not
5320  * already queue a different error reported by the destination server. */
5321  if (!error_from_target && socket_error) {
5322  may_retry = 0;
5323  goto socket_err;
5324  }
5325 
5326  if (!error_from_target) {
5327  /* Success! Update the last_dbid in migrateCachedSocket, so that we can
5328  * avoid SELECT the next time if the target DB is the same. Reply +OK.
5329  *
5330  * Note: If we reached this point, even if socket_error is true
5331  * still the SELECT command succeeded (otherwise the code jumps to
5332  * socket_err label. */
5333  cs->last_dbid = dbid;
5334  addReply(c,shared.ok);
5335  } else {
5336  /* On error we already sent it in the for loop above, and set
5337  * the currently selected socket to -1 to force SELECT the next time. */
5338  }
5339 
5340  sdsfree(cmd.io.buffer.ptr);
5341  zfree(ov); zfree(kv); zfree(newargv);
5342  return;
5343 
5344 /* On socket errors we try to close the cached socket and try again.
5345  * It is very common for the cached socket to get closed, if just reopening
5346  * it works it's a shame to notify the error to the caller. */
5347 socket_err:
5348  /* Cleanup we want to perform in both the retry and no retry case.
5349  * Note: Closing the migrate socket will also force SELECT next time. */
5350  sdsfree(cmd.io.buffer.ptr);
5351 
5352  /* If the command was rewritten as DEL and there was a socket error,
5353  * we already closed the socket earlier. While migrateCloseSocket()
5354  * is idempotent, the host/port arguments are now gone, so don't do it
5355  * again. */
5356  if (!argv_rewritten) migrateCloseSocket(c->argv[1],c->argv[2]);
5357  zfree(newargv);
5358  newargv = NULL; /* This will get reallocated on retry. */
5359 
5360  /* Retry only if it's not a timeout and we never attempted a retry
5361  * (or the code jumping here did not set may_retry to zero). */
5362  if (errno != ETIMEDOUT && may_retry) {
5363  may_retry = 0;
5364  goto try_again;
5365  }
5366 
5367  /* Cleanup we want to do if no retry is attempted. */
5368  zfree(ov); zfree(kv);
5369  addReplySds(c,
5370  sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
5371  "-IOERR error or timeout %s to target instance\r\n",
5372  write_error ? "writing" : "reading"));
5373  return;
5374 }
5375 
5376 /* -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
5377  * Cluster functions related to serving / redirecting clients
5378  * -------------------------------------------------------------------------- */
5379 
5380 /* The ASKING command is required after a -ASK redirection.
5381  * The client should issue ASKING before to actually send the command to
5382  * the target instance. See the Redis Cluster specification for more
5383  * information. */
5384 void askingCommand(client *c) {
5385  if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
5386  addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
5387  return;
5388  }
5389  c->flags |= CLIENT_ASKING;
5390  addReply(c,shared.ok);
5391 }
5392 
5393 /* The READONLY command is used by clients to enter the read-only mode.
5394  * In this mode slaves will not redirect clients as long as clients access
5395  * with read-only commands to keys that are served by the slave's master. */
5396 void readonlyCommand(client *c) {
5397  if (server.cluster_enabled == 0) {
5398  addReplyError(c,"This instance has cluster support disabled");
5399  return;
5400  }
5401  c->flags |= CLIENT_READONLY;
5402  addReply(c,shared.ok);
5403 }
5404 
5405 /* The READWRITE command just clears the READONLY command state. */
5406 void readwriteCommand(client *c) {
5407  c->flags &= ~CLIENT_READONLY;
5408  addReply(c,shared.ok);
5409 }
5410 
5411 /* Return the pointer to the cluster node that is able to serve the command.
5412  * For the function to succeed the command should only target either:
5413  *
5414  * 1) A single key (even multiple times like LPOPRPUSH mylist mylist).
5415  * 2) Multiple keys in the same hash slot, while the slot is stable (no
5416  * resharding in progress).
5417  *
5418  * On success the function returns the node that is able to serve the request.
5419  * If the node is not 'myself' a redirection must be perfomed. The kind of
5420  * redirection is specified setting the integer passed by reference
5421  * 'error_code', which will be set to CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK or
5422  * CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED.
5423  *
5424  * When the node is 'myself' 'error_code' is set to CLUSTER_REDIR_NONE.
5425  *
5426  * If the command fails NULL is returned, and the reason of the failure is
5427  * provided via 'error_code', which will be set to:
5428  *
5429  * CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT if the request contains multiple keys that
5430  * don't belong to the same hash slot.
5431  *
5432  * CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE if the request contains multiple keys
5433  * belonging to the same slot, but the slot is not stable (in migration or
5434  * importing state, likely because a resharding is in progress).
5435  *
5436  * CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND if the request addresses a slot which is
5437  * not bound to any node. In this case the cluster global state should be
5438  * already "down" but it is fragile to rely on the update of the global state,
5439  * so we also handle it here.
5440  *
5441  * CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE if the cluster is down but the user attempts to
5442  * execute a command that addresses one or more keys. */
5443 clusterNode *getNodeByQuery(client *c, struct redisCommand *cmd, robj **argv, int argc, int *hashslot, int *error_code) {
5444  clusterNode *n = NULL;
5445  robj *firstkey = NULL;
5446  int multiple_keys = 0;
5447  multiState *ms, _ms;
5448  multiCmd mc;
5449  int i, slot = 0, migrating_slot = 0, importing_slot = 0, missing_keys = 0;
5450 
5451  /* Allow any key to be set if a module disabled cluster redirections. */
5452  if (server.cluster_module_flags & CLUSTER_MODULE_FLAG_NO_REDIRECTION)
5453  return myself;
5454 
5455  /* Set error code optimistically for the base case. */
5456  if (error_code) *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_NONE;
5457 
5458  /* Modules can turn off Redis Cluster redirection: this is useful
5459  * when writing a module that implements a completely different
5460  * distributed system. */
5461 
5462  /* We handle all the cases as if they were EXEC commands, so we have
5463  * a common code path for everything */
5464  if (cmd->proc == execCommand) {
5465  /* If CLIENT_MULTI flag is not set EXEC is just going to return an
5466  * error. */
5467  if (!(c->flags & CLIENT_MULTI)) return myself;
5468  ms = &c->mstate;
5469  } else {
5470  /* In order to have a single codepath create a fake Multi State
5471  * structure if the client is not in MULTI/EXEC state, this way
5472  * we have a single codepath below. */
5473  ms = &_ms;
5474  _ms.commands = &mc;
5475  _ms.count = 1;
5476  mc.argv = argv;
5477  mc.argc = argc;
5478  mc.cmd = cmd;
5479  }
5480 
5481  /* Check that all the keys are in the same hash slot, and obtain this
5482  * slot and the node associated. */
5483  for (i = 0; i < ms->count; i++) {
5484  struct redisCommand *mcmd;
5485  robj **margv;
5486  int margc, *keyindex, numkeys, j;
5487 
5488  mcmd = ms->commands[i].cmd;
5489  margc = ms->commands[i].argc;
5490  margv = ms->commands[i].argv;
5491 
5492  keyindex = getKeysFromCommand(mcmd,margv,margc,&numkeys);
5493  for (j = 0; j < numkeys; j++) {
5494  robj *thiskey = margv[keyindex[j]];
5495  int thisslot = keyHashSlot((char*)thiskey->ptr,
5496  sdslen(thiskey->ptr));
5497 
5498  if (firstkey == NULL) {
5499  /* This is the first key we see. Check what is the slot
5500  * and node. */
5501  firstkey = thiskey;
5502  slot = thisslot;
5503  n = server.cluster->slots[slot];
5504 
5505  /* Error: If a slot is not served, we are in "cluster down"
5506  * state. However the state is yet to be updated, so this was
5507  * not trapped earlier in processCommand(). Report the same
5508  * error to the client. */
5509  if (n == NULL) {
5510  getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
5511  if (error_code)
5512  *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND;
5513  return NULL;
5514  }
5515 
5516  /* If we are migrating or importing this slot, we need to check
5517  * if we have all the keys in the request (the only way we
5518  * can safely serve the request, otherwise we return a TRYAGAIN
5519  * error). To do so we set the importing/migrating state and
5520  * increment a counter for every missing key. */
5521  if (n == myself &&
5522  server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot] != NULL)
5523  {
5524  migrating_slot = 1;
5525  } else if (server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] != NULL) {
5526  importing_slot = 1;
5527  }
5528  } else {
5529  /* If it is not the first key, make sure it is exactly
5530  * the same key as the first we saw. */
5531  if (!equalStringObjects(firstkey,thiskey)) {
5532  if (slot != thisslot) {
5533  /* Error: multiple keys from different slots. */
5534  getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
5535  if (error_code)
5536  *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT;
5537  return NULL;
5538  } else {
5539  /* Flag this request as one with multiple different
5540  * keys. */
5541  multiple_keys = 1;
5542  }
5543  }
5544  }
5545 
5546  /* Migarting / Improrting slot? Count keys we don't have. */
5547  if ((migrating_slot || importing_slot) &&
5548  lookupKeyRead(&server.db[0],thiskey) == NULL)
5549  {
5550  missing_keys++;
5551  }
5552  }
5553  getKeysFreeResult(keyindex);
5554  }
5555 
5556  /* No key at all in command? then we can serve the request
5557  * without redirections or errors in all the cases. */
5558  if (n == NULL) return myself;
5559 
5560  /* Cluster is globally down but we got keys? We can't serve the request. */
5561  if (server.cluster->state != CLUSTER_OK) {
5562  if (error_code) *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE;
5563  return NULL;
5564  }
5565 
5566  /* Return the hashslot by reference. */
5567  if (hashslot) *hashslot = slot;
5568 
5569  /* MIGRATE always works in the context of the local node if the slot
5570  * is open (migrating or importing state). We need to be able to freely
5571  * move keys among instances in this case. */
5572  if ((migrating_slot || importing_slot) && cmd->proc == migrateCommand)
5573  return myself;
5574 
5575  /* If we don't have all the keys and we are migrating the slot, send
5576  * an ASK redirection. */
5577  if (migrating_slot && missing_keys) {
5578  if (error_code) *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK;
5579  return server.cluster->migrating_slots_to[slot];
5580  }
5581 
5582  /* If we are receiving the slot, and the client correctly flagged the
5583  * request as "ASKING", we can serve the request. However if the request
5584  * involves multiple keys and we don't have them all, the only option is
5585  * to send a TRYAGAIN error. */
5586  if (importing_slot &&
5587  (c->flags & CLIENT_ASKING || cmd->flags & CMD_ASKING))
5588  {
5589  if (multiple_keys && missing_keys) {
5590  if (error_code) *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE;
5591  return NULL;
5592  } else {
5593  return myself;
5594  }
5595  }
5596 
5597  /* Handle the read-only client case reading from a slave: if this
5598  * node is a slave and the request is about an hash slot our master
5599  * is serving, we can reply without redirection. */
5600  if (c->flags & CLIENT_READONLY &&
5601  (cmd->flags & CMD_READONLY || cmd->proc == evalCommand ||
5602  cmd->proc == evalShaCommand) &&
5603  nodeIsSlave(myself) &&
5604  myself->slaveof == n)
5605  {
5606  return myself;
5607  }
5608 
5609  /* Base case: just return the right node. However if this node is not
5610  * myself, set error_code to MOVED since we need to issue a rediretion. */
5611  if (n != myself && error_code) *error_code = CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED;
5612  return n;
5613 }
5614 
5615 /* Send the client the right redirection code, according to error_code
5616  * that should be set to one of CLUSTER_REDIR_* macros.
5617  *
5618  * If CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK or CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED error codes
5619  * are used, then the node 'n' should not be NULL, but should be the
5620  * node we want to mention in the redirection. Moreover hashslot should
5621  * be set to the hash slot that caused the redirection. */
5622 void clusterRedirectClient(client *c, clusterNode *n, int hashslot, int error_code) {
5623  if (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_CROSS_SLOT) {
5624  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CROSSSLOT Keys in request don't hash to the same slot\r\n"));
5625  } else if (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_UNSTABLE) {
5626  /* The request spawns multiple keys in the same slot,
5627  * but the slot is not "stable" currently as there is
5628  * a migration or import in progress. */
5629  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-TRYAGAIN Multiple keys request during rehashing of slot\r\n"));
5630  } else if (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE) {
5631  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CLUSTERDOWN The cluster is down\r\n"));
5632  } else if (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND) {
5633  addReplySds(c,sdsnew("-CLUSTERDOWN Hash slot not served\r\n"));
5634  } else if (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED ||
5635  error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK)
5636  {
5637  addReplySds(c,sdscatprintf(sdsempty(),
5638  "-%s %d %s:%d\r\n",
5639  (error_code == CLUSTER_REDIR_ASK) ? "ASK" : "MOVED",
5640  hashslot,n->ip,n->port));
5641  } else {
5642  serverPanic("getNodeByQuery() unknown error.");
5643  }
5644 }
5645 
5646 /* This function is called by the function processing clients incrementally
5647  * to detect timeouts, in order to handle the following case:
5648  *
5649  * 1) A client blocks with BLPOP or similar blocking operation.
5650  * 2) The master migrates the hash slot elsewhere or turns into a slave.
5651  * 3) The client may remain blocked forever (or up to the max timeout time)
5652  * waiting for a key change that will never happen.
5653  *
5654  * If the client is found to be blocked into an hash slot this node no
5655  * longer handles, the client is sent a redirection error, and the function
5656  * returns 1. Otherwise 0 is returned and no operation is performed. */
5657 int clusterRedirectBlockedClientIfNeeded(client *c) {
5658  if (c->flags & CLIENT_BLOCKED &&
5659  (c->btype == BLOCKED_LIST ||
5660  c->btype == BLOCKED_ZSET ||
5661  c->btype == BLOCKED_STREAM))
5662  {
5663  dictEntry *de;
5664  dictIterator *di;
5665 
5666  /* If the cluster is down, unblock the client with the right error. */
5667  if (server.cluster->state == CLUSTER_FAIL) {
5668  clusterRedirectClient(c,NULL,0,CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_STATE);
5669  return 1;
5670  }
5671 
5672  /* All keys must belong to the same slot, so check first key only. */
5673  di = dictGetIterator(c->bpop.keys);
5674  if ((de = dictNext(di)) != NULL) {
5675  robj *key = dictGetKey(de);
5676  int slot = keyHashSlot((char*)key->ptr, sdslen(key->ptr));
5677  clusterNode *node = server.cluster->slots[slot];
5678 
5679  /* We send an error and unblock the client if:
5680  * 1) The slot is unassigned, emitting a cluster down error.
5681  * 2) The slot is not handled by this node, nor being imported. */
5682  if (node != myself &&
5683  server.cluster->importing_slots_from[slot] == NULL)
5684  {
5685  if (node == NULL) {
5686  clusterRedirectClient(c,NULL,0,
5687  CLUSTER_REDIR_DOWN_UNBOUND);
5688  } else {
5689  clusterRedirectClient(c,node,slot,
5690  CLUSTER_REDIR_MOVED);
5691  }
5692  dictReleaseIterator(di);
5693  return 1;
5694  }
5695  }
5696  dictReleaseIterator(di);
5697  }
5698  return 0;
5699 }
